description:
The food was absolutely delicious! I just moved to the area, and I'm so thrilled I happened to find this restaurant and give it a chance. Absolutely try the spaghetti and meatballs, the lobster ravioli, and/or the tiramisu if you make it here. 

Don't be late, though! Reservations evaporate after 5 minutes and the staff will claim it's been 10.
author: Peter L.

description:
Quaint restaurant at the corner of Sutter and Mason. It was very crowded on Thursday night. Reservations are strongly recommended as this is a small restaurant. 

Service was slow. The wait staff seemed understaffed and somewhat stressed. The kitchen is partially visible, and looked to be manned by two cooks. They were hustling, but had a hard time keeping up with the full dining room.

We started with fried calamari. The calamari was heavily battered and deep fried. It is served with a small side of spinach and some grilled artichokes. It is a huge portion that was enough to be shared by a party of four or more. A little overcooked, I thought this appetizer was pretty average.

I ordered the Spaghetti and Meatballs. The presentation was lovely. Three large meatballs with a generous pile of pasta. I thought the meatballs were yummy, but the marinara gravy was just okay.

Cesario's wasn't bad, but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine here. It is convenient if you are staying at JW or Donatello.
author: Paul C.

description:
I've tried the Fettuccine Alfredo, Butternut Squash Ravioli, Truffle Gnocchi and the Veal Parmesan. All were exceptional. Ultimately, I would recommend the Veal Parmesan above all the others. It's both a comparatively larger plate of food and also exceptional blend of flavors. I've now had it twice and am eager to have it again!

Wait staff are attentive and kind. Atmosphere is distinctly cozy and inviting -- perfect for a warm Italian dish.
author: Ty B.

description:
I have lived in the area for a long time and never had an oppty or reason to stop by. Another place we intended to have dinner recently changed their menu so we were desperate to find someplace to eat. 

Bread served with olive oil wasn't very good although perhaps that's subjective. 

Had dinner here and the food was average. Soup appetizer was fine but I did wonder whether it was freshly made or if it came out of a can. 

My entree was the lasagne and while the lasagne itself had a good taste/consistency, I could do without the thick layer of cheese that was on top. It was so thick it interfered with the taste of each bite so I peeled it off after my 2nd bite. The veggies on the side were steamed and nothing special. 

My friend's pasta dish was average but was made better with the addition of salt. 

Didn't bother looking at the dessert menu.
author: D L.

description:
I went here starving in between shows next door. Since I was only one, I was able to get  a seat right away! Service was pretty good though the bread they gave while ordering was almost cold/ or old? & though the olive oil pesto combo was a good dip, I couldn't really enjoy it. 

The service was good! The lobster ravioli was a special and didn't disappoint! It was quite rich so I needed A LOT of passed out Parmesan cheese to cut through the fat. It was pretty good though!
author: Cay A.

description: Ambiance is close quartered, but the food makes up for it. We had the veal and chicken parm. It was excellent!
author: Laurie L.

description:
I visited here during my first day of SF trip during August. I believe I had a Chicken Parmesan and a tomato pasta.

The food was okay, the Chicken Parm was a little salty for my taste. However, the service by the Asian lady was really bad. There were literally only 2 other parties in the house, but we were seated right next to the door. 

Not going to come back for my future SF trips.
author: Peter J.

description:
This place is surprisingly good. It was very close to where we were staying so we stopped by Cesario's for the convenience. We had walked by before and noticed it got pretty busy during dinner time.

The portions are pretty big and the pastas here are delicious. We tried the bruschetta and it was good, not the best though. It's a really small restaurant and the tables are real close to each other so be prepared to be intimate with the other parties. 

What I liked the most was the food was fresh. Our dish came out piping hot, just the way I like it.
author: Jean K.

description:
By far the best Italian restaurant I have ever been too. 
Good customer service and food was ready 15 minutes after ordering
author: Bradley M.

description:
Place was so cold I had to leave to get a jacket!!! Recommend you refuse the table next to the door. On top of that I hadmy entree spilled in my lap. So over all it was a shitty experience. 

The flavor of the food was ok, but based on price, place, and service I will NOT ever visit there again. I believe that the cost does not justify what is served.

 do 10 times better eating at the Steak House at the Marine Memorial Club. The price of the check would be the same, you'd enjoy beautiful view of the city and not be blasted by cold air cooling your food every time someone opens the door. In short I've had a better meal and service at InNOut!
author: JB W.

description: Unbelievably bad experience tonight. My party is accustomed to eating here prior to theater events at the Marines Memorial.  In the past we have had only good experiences.  Tonight we had a 6:30 reservation.  Everyone was there and seated at 6:30 (this becomes important later).  We received beverages and ordered food at 6:45, including an appetizer.  At 7:40, we had not received even a moment of staff attention.  We had no food, and our beverage glasses were long empty.  As we had theater tickets next door for 8pm, we inquired when our food would arrive.  The waitperson chastised us for asking, saying that the next table were seated before us, and they didn't have their food yet, so we should not complain.  A manager came over and told us that because 2 members of our party arrived 15 minutes early, that "threw the kitchen off" and that's why we had no food an hour after placing our order.  Shortly thereafter our food arrived.  All of it was severely overcooked, particularly fish and chicken items.   The added indignity is that all five entrees were cold.  One person with an allergy had asked if a dish had a problematic ingredient, and was told no - only to receive a plate including copious amounts of it.  The appetizer never arrived at all.  At no point did anyone apologize for the wait, the service, or the food issues.  When the bill arrived, it was for the full amount, including the appetizer that we didn't receive.  Voices had to be raised in order to get it removed from the bill.   Epically poor experience.  Any house can have a bad night - it's all about how you handle it.  Not recommended.
author: scout s.

description:
My husband and I chose this place for my birthday dinner. We reserved a late dinner so I did not bring my wallet because I don't like walking in a new city, at night with it out. When I was not asked for my ID when looking at wine and asking for wine pairing recommendations, I assumed she did not need it as she noticed I was old enough. I was flattered but very annoyed after 20 minutes or so of choosing a wine and her bringing us different bottles that she then asked for my ID. Wasted my time, but understandable. 

Now, the service did not match the prices on the menu unfortunately. The host did not welcome us and we saw no smiles or enjoyment in their work. It was a small place and full as it was, there was plenty of staff for the service to go smoothly. The "house bread" was soft but served cold. When our food came out, my penne was undercooked, chewy and stuck to the roof of my mouth. 

The ambience was off at that point and my birthday dinner went down the drain. So, we asked for boxes and a bag- I told her the problem and that we would like to have the check and to leave. After that, EVERYONE was rude to us. She rolled her eyes at us, they did nothing to rectify the nasty dish or take it off the check. Our waitress seemed annoyed at us for a problem they created. My husband still left a 15% tip at least.

All in all, I would not recommend this restaurant because the prices do not match the food that is cooked nor the service that is given. Find another restaurant or you will be just as disappointed as we were.
author: Kallista T.

description: Nice authentic Italian resteraunt.  Great service.  The food was excellent.  Wine selection is above average.  Nice views of the city.
author: Scott S.

description:
This is my first review and tried to refuse to write it but they do not deserve. Rude Asian server (please do not wrong understand ) also manager was too. 

Food was even not average. Probably all ingredients from restaurant depot or Costco. There is nothing belongs to Italy nor Italian food. Such a shame! Couldn't eat my  main course. (My order was  linguine carbonara) 

My main point is servers! It was awful!
author: Ezra E.

description: I got the Lobster stuffed ravioli in an Asiago cream sauce, garnished with basil and diced tomatoes, topped with 2 grilled prawns. Soooo yummy and perfect portions not to much, not too little. My friend got the Cappellini Gambari so much flavor so well put together! I wish we had a place this good back in Arizona  the service was nice and everything came out in a timely manner.
author: Rob N.

description: I really enjoyed this meal! I got the Chicken Parmesan for $20. It was plenty of food and could have been split between two people. The food was great, and the servers were helpful and polite. We were unaware of the group gratuity, which is only for groups 5 and over. That seems fairly small for a mandatory gratuity. Excellent food for a slightly more fancy night out.
author: Nathan B.

description: The Italian fare is simple yet delicious!!! I had to wait for almost 25 min for a table but well worth it. I had a nice view of the city and the restaurant is tiny yet cozy. I'm thinking of coming here again tomorrow night for dessert as I never leave enough room for dinner and dessert . I very much enjoyed tonight's dining experience.
author: Dee G.

description: Last night I had a lasagna and an Italian red wine and it was definitely one of the best experiences I had so far in San Francisco. Great ambiance, amazing waitress, superb food and a very affordable bill. Wonderful​ night. Will do it again soon!
author: Cris B.

description: Service was impeccable! The bread, evoo and pesto was fantastic! Pasta was cooked perfectly! Great Italiano joint in the great city of San Francisco! Will see you next time!
author: Phil C.

description:
The Tuscan chicken was really solid. Loved the capers, sundried tomatoes, garlic, and polenta

There is a $15 cork fee FYI

We came in at 6:30 on a Friday no problem or wait. Staff was friendly.

Can't say it's my absolute favorite spot but can understand why tourists staying in the area might check it out
author: Ellyn B.

description:
Smaller in size but stylish, with mandatory reservations on most days, this restaurant has a varied yet very Italian menu.

The butternut squash ravioli were soft and luscious and full of flavor. The gnocchi were pillowy yet had a presence and probably the best I've ever had.

 Located around the block from Union Square with very nice and accommodating staff, reasonable prices are another plus.
author: Jerry P.

description: We sat at the first table when you walk in. We were lucky to get a table because this place is busy and always has reservations. The food in my opinion was ok. I am from Texas so food tasted a little bland to me but must be more authentic I got the Lobster Ravioli. The calamari was good. Overall I think its worth a try at least once.
author: Seneta B.

description:
While visiting SanFran w/ my 13 year old son, we had the need for some Italian food. Called and explained we didn't have a reservation, a Sunday night) and could they squeeze us in. Gentleman on the phone asked how far away we were (3 blocks) and said if we came right now, he'd find a table.

In we walked and true to his word, sat us immediately. Within 10 minutes, wine was being poured and our order taken.

Food was tasty w/ nice size portions, fast attentive and friendly service made for a great evening.  Entrees are reasonable priced, as is the wine menu.

A little noisy, but in a good way. Totally reminds me of some of the Italian restaurants in Philly & NYC. Not too fancy, but not a "chain" vibe either. Maybe a local "joint", if that makes sense.

In the end, would I go there again? Yes, and I'm pretty confident the experience would be just a great.
author: Greg F.

description: My husband and I have been to Italy many times. Cesario's reminded us so much of restaurants we've enjoyed in Milan and Florence. The atmosphere, the food - even the owner - authentic!  We had a cozy, romantic seat by the window.  We both ordered the salmon with white wine and capers, served with risotto and sauteed spinach: excellent!  For dessert, my husband had a wonderful Tiramisu, and I had creme brulee'...Yes, it's a well-known French dessert: but it, too, was absolutely delicious! So, if you're looking for an authentic European dining experience (as opposed to one the many "ethnic-inspired-cooking-show-eateries" that are sweeping the nation) - then do visit Cesario's. Real Italian, right in San Fransisco.
author: Karen L.

description: Still an intimate restaurant with genuinely kind service and superb food! She did spill hot soup in his zipper area but we kept eating...
author: Rolanda S.

description: The polenta lasagna is amazing! Literally the best lasagna I have ever had. The gelato is great, too!!
author: Tara K.

description:
We came in at 12:30PM for lunch. We ordered garlic cheese bread, Burger, and chicken Alfredo. The garlic cheese came and it was delicious.

It's been half an hour and the other 2 tables got their food before us. All we ordered was burger and chicken Alfredo. The food finally came and it was not good... I can cook better pasta than that and the burger was RARE! We asked for medium well. If we send it back, it would take another 30 minutes, so we just left. Would not be back.
author: ZhiCheng Z.

description: We came here five years ago this place is amazing truly authentic wonderful Italian food as well as great wine list friendly service and just a wonderful all around authentic place to be!
author: Jim L.

description:
Not sure how this place has such a high rating. This, to me, is the definition of a tourist trap. I don't know if there were any locals there but it was just not good food. The service was the only redeeming quality of this place. The wine list seemed overpriced for what they had. The half bottle tasted like the stuff they would serve to people at a timeshare informational. The seafood paella risotto was anything but like a paella or a risotto. The seafood looked like it was rejected by Costco and ended up on the conveyor belt of a sushi train place for demo before it came to the kitchen.  

The dessert which was complimentary was the best part by far hence the two star rating. The owner/manager asked us to move because there was a bigger group coming and therefore they gave us dessert as tribute for moving. The servers and everyone working was very nice and friendly which is why they got more than just a one star rating. If I ever happen to go there again, I should probably stick to the regular menu items and not the stuff they advertised on the nightly special on the board outside.
author: Zain R.

description: Managers awesome. Excellent food. Number one choice for Italian restaurant. Every dish that came out was perfect.
author: Jake T.

description: I was staying just down the street and looking for Italian and noticed Cesario's. Enjoyed my meal very much - don't get the negative comments. Bitter Yelpers, I assume. Not me. The only criticism is that since it is a very intimate (small) space you are definitely sitting right on top of others. But the atmosphere is nice, the servers great and attentive and the food all wonderful. I enjoyed a starter salad, special lobster ravioli, house red wine and capped it off with tiramisu and porto. I would recommend it as a nice neighborhood place that is all class. If you are looking for a large space, perhaps not for you.
author: mark w.

description:
Adorably little place VERY busy. Here for work - alone. Great seat by open window people watching. Awesome wine Ravage Cabernet 
Excellent food!  Had linguine Pancetta. SO many mushrooms and Pancetta cooked perfectly.  Good prices for wine and food!
author: Lauren C.

description: Inviting, warm, and comfortable environment. Salmon tasted super fresh and absolutely perfect! Oh my, so yummy! Real authentic food that doesn't hit you in the pocketbook. Staff was welcoming, intuitive, and there when needed. A couple blocks off of Union Square. Love it!
author: Maile C.

description:
Oh my goodness. This place is a real gem. 
The food here was amazing and the service was delightful. 

We started with the Pear Salad which was amazing. Definitely try it if you haven't already. The walnuts really make it. 

Then we ordered the linguine carbonara and I totally forgot the name of the other dish but if you show them the picture I'm sure they'll know. 

The linguine was delicious. Perfectly creamy with a nice amount of diced bacon and peas. The noodles were textured perfectly and it was so filling I could only eat half. The plates are huge so I didn't realize how much food there really was. 

The other dish was tasty as well. Not so creamy but definitely had a nice smoky flavor which went perfect with the light tomato sauce. 

I paired my linguine with the house Pinot Grigio and it was divine. 

I'll definitely be returning.
author: Veronica S.

description: Best linguini carbonara I've ever had!! I can't believe this place only have 3 1/2 stars
author: Donna S.

description:
Ordered through Eat24...Wish I could give Eat24 1 star for this instead of docking a star but what choice do I have? It took over an hour to get my entree credited back to my card after I finally took matters into my own hands and called the restaurant myself. I spoke with the manager Alex-- it was a strange interaction as I asked for the manager, he said he was it but when asked his name he was hesitant to provide it...what kinda manager does that? You're leading by example (I would hope) and hiding your identity from customers calling the restaurant is weird. Maybe he wasn't the real manager but he did take care of me, so thanks, Alex. 

The food was luke warm upon arrival and the chicken was literally rubber. I had my girlfriend try it and she couldn't even recognize it as chicken! It was cut into 4-5 pieces and while it smelled good, the texture was horrifying. The $12 salad is really a glorified side. Very disappointing. 

3 stars for the pasta, 2 stars for the salad, -1 star for Eat24 customer service, 1 star for the chicken since the potatoes and veggies were edible. 

Will revise my review if I decide to dine in but the delivery is not recommended.
author: Nikki M.

description: I took a chance on this place after reading mixed reviews. The restaurant is very small, but I went at lunchtime on Monday and was seated right away. The decor is a little outdated, but I never judge a book by its cover. The food was OUTSTANDING. Absolutely delicious and plated beautifully. The waitress was very friendly. The minestrone soup was very good, but the real star of my meal was the lunch special, the truffle gnocchi. Incredible. The gnocchi looked and tasted homemade, though I cannot confirm. I know that they do use Barilla spaghetti. The only thing that made me uncomfortable was that it is an open kitchen and the kitchen staff did stare at me for quite some time. Otherwise, the place was wonderful. Will definitely be returning.
author: Brianna L.

description: Tried to have dinner here. Only one in the place. Ask for pasta with my veal piccata.  Thought I farted in church. No, you can't have pasta. It's mashed potatoes or some other crap I didn't want. The "chef" won't substitute...fine, guess they want the place to stay empty. Good lucn
author: Tim H.

description: Went here for lunch while attending a conference.  What a pleasant surprise.  The portions were generous and the flavor was amazing.  I ordered the eggplant parmigiana.  My lunch partner had an alfredo dish, we were both very impressed.  Waitstaff was courteous and attentive despite the growing number of tables to attend.  I'd come back again!
author: Christopher M.

description:
Food very bland.... No flavours... very unimpressive
Two stars instead of one cause service was decent.
author: Del B.

description:
Meh. Mediocre Italian food for lunch. It was marginally better than having a burger.

The service was nice. The interior was nice. 

I probably wouldn't ever go back if I lived nearby.
author: Terry D.

description: Decided to go here for dinner near our hotel.  Made a reservation but the maitre d' seemed not to care and was very unfriendly.  We ordered chicken Parmesan and an eggplant Parmesan which came with pasta.  Neither dish tasted great and was not worth the money.  No one even said good-bye or thank you as we left.  I would not go back.
author: Toni L.

description: My son had surgery today and we are far from home, finding a place that will accommodate diet restrictions, be helpful with a to-go order and has great wine was not easy but Cesario's was so kind! I got back to my hotel room and finally tasted the food and it is amazing!!! Thank you to the staff and chefs for an amazing dinner!!!
author: Jenna B.

description: I ordered the lobster ravioli and it was frozen. I didn't pay a frozen cost wasn't happy about that. Wouldn't suggest eating here there are better places nearby. Food quality was below what was expected. I'm pretty sure they spend more money on what the restaurant looks like rather than the food.
author: Brianna W.

description: Food tasted pretty bland but the staff was so sweet. Out of the fettuccine and lasagna get the lasagna it has a bit more flavor. They do look delicious though.
author: Maricela O.

description: Mediocre Italian Food! My husband and I were starving and decided to just stop in here for a quick bite . The calamari was OK and lobster ravioli didn't taste fresh at all. Not the best Italian food that's for sure. I wouldn't come back .
author: Marcelle R.

description: The food is great . The atmosphere is very charming . I stuffed my face with soup and appetizers and they both came out very tasty. My bf is vegetarian so he ordered the butternut ravioli and he said they are quite good. I like my grilled chicken penne- and yah they have me a huge portion of chicken. Love the restaurant. We'll come back here if we are in the city again .
author: Hieu N.

description:
Totally agree with getting the window seat!
Not just for the entertaining views but to have some air to breathe. Tables are extremely close together and there was only air from the one open window. Cooled us as well as our food.
I had eggplant parmigiana. There was a slab of mozzarella on top of the eggplant that was barely melted so I easily removed it. The only sauce on the eggplant was right under the mozzarella cheese. There was a layer of sauce, fried eggplant, ricotta cheese, a slice of tomato then another layer of the same. Not a good representation of eggplant parmigiana... my favorite.
Would not recommend this restaurant for good Italian food.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Stumbled open this restaurant on the walking tour, and returned for lunch - truffle gnocchi was excellent. Noticed others ordering pasta and panini - all dishes looked great. Great value, too.  highly recommend
author: Mark G.

description: Food is very tastey.  The only reason for 4 stars was I found staff not as attentive as I would like.   I had to indicate I needed more water and it was not busy.  Also, check came without being asked if I wanted anything else.  I would definitely return.
author: Cathy B.

description: Authentic Italian food and great customer service! The Italian cuisine is one of my favorite and dining at Cesario's was the right choice! Every single meal cooked at finest! Recommend to all
author: Assel D.

description: Cannot believe it took me this long to try this cozy restaurant with excellent service. The restaurant is quite small so I would definitely recommend a reservation. I didn't have a reservation but staff was so attentive. Good wine selection( we had glass of house red from italy). Also they give us bread with great dipping pesto oil. Our server Anna recommended to us Penne Basilico and Veal parmesan. It was so good portions and delicious. Really nice place on SF downtown area. I'm giving 5 star for very attentive service, and authentic italian food. Great experience for my first time!
author: Andrew F.

description: This restaurant was recommended by a friend. It did not disappoint. I only wish I had arrived hungrier.  The bread was served with a lovely herbed oil. They have a lovely selection of wine, including by the glass. I ordered a salad with pear, it was large enough to split. I had spaghetti and meatballs and my husband had the special gnocchi.  His was the superior dinner. My spaghetti was good, but the gnocchi was excellent. The service was friendly and efficient. This is sort of an old school place... Great for adults.
author: Sheri G.

description: It was just ok not great, flavor was lacking...with so many restaurants in the area we would not go back. My hubby said Olive Garden was better & that's not saying much.
author: Mary D.

description: Four of us dined at  Cesario's to celebrate my birthday. We all enjoyed our meals and left nothing on our plates! My Chicken Marsala with Risotto was delicious. My husband had the Chicken Parmesan which I tasted and it was also very good. Our waitress was cordial and service was great.  I am pretty picky with food because I consider myself a good cook. The only thing that I could say was not perfect was that my chicken could have been more tender. There were three of what I would call cutlets of breast meat that would seem to be of that size due to pounding them which would have made them more tender. So I'm not sure why the chicken was a little too firm. But the Marsala was so delicious that I was able to put that aside and enjoy the meal.
author: Susan C.

description: Stopped in for a late lunch.  Very cozy and tradional Italian place with large windows giving it a great feel.  Excellent food and great staff.
author: Marc H.

description: Great food! Honestly have no idea why this place has a 3.5. I am pretty strict with giving a 5, but really good service and food here.
author: Brad J.

description: My wife and I dropped in here after noticing it on a walk - darling little place with a romantic charm to it.  No red flags at all.  Will try it again.
author: Richard C.

description: Would have loved to have tried the food.  When I entered the restaurant it smelled great and there was a line to get in.  Once the folks ahead of me were seated I saw an open table for 2.  The hostess/manager came up to me and when I told her the table was for 1 person, she told me it would be a 10 minute wait.  I  agreed and waited.  Shortly thereafter, a two-top became available at the window.  Two men in back of me entered the restaurant and one walked up to a waitress and said - you remember me right?  Can I have a seat by the window.  He had not been waiting in line but he had been there before and the waitress remembered him.  She sat them right away as I still waited.  Suddenly 4 tables were available and then a party of 4 walked in and got seated.  At that point I was not happy at all.  It's taken me a long time to get comfortable eating as a party of 1 and I was not being treated like parties of 2 or more.  I complained to the hostess/manager and she said the party of 4 had been waiting next door.  Still doesn't explain the party of 2 that was seated ahead of me.  Plus there were many open tables and I was still standing.  I have been in the hospitality industry for over 30 years and this was not what I would call being hospitable.  After I complained, I walked out and found a fantastic restaurant that had no problem with a party of one.  Maybe one day I'll taste the food here - not sure I want to try again though.
author: Robin R.

description:
We stopped here before a play on a Friday night.  Luckily, we got there about 6:00, because we were seated right away.  When we left at 7:00 it was packed.  The place is very small, but the table arrangement is very well done to maximize seating without having the tables super close.  Additionally, the staff is attentive and very efficient, as everyone pitched in to help serve, bus, etc. and you didn't have to wait for *your* server when you wanted something.
I had the clam chowder and bruschetta - both were very good.  You could taste the clams in the soup (maybe some would say it was fishy - I liked it) and the bruschetta was fresh and tasty.  My husband had the Cappellini Gamberi, also very good.  The cream sauce was very light - not like an alfredo.
For dessert we had the cannoli.  OK, the outside was a little TOO hard and crispy, but the inside was excellent.
For the price, overall it was excellent.  It was much less expensive than some of the other places we looked at, and they would have had to be WAY better to justify the price hike.
author: Lydia C.

description:
My husband and I are visiting San Fran from Oklahoma. We decided to try this place and it was great! We split the Caesar salad. I got the chicken piccata with angel hair pasta and he had the chicken parm. He said it was the best chicken parm he had ever had.. we for sure recommend this place. 

Oh! And another upside, the restaurant is so quaint, cozy and just has a great feel to it.
author: Kellie M.

description: Arrived in San Fran late afternoon. This place was a block from our hotel, we were looking for a great Italian meal. We found it here. Quaint little place where the food tastes like the recipes came for the old country. The bread and pesto/olive oil was great, salads were wonderful. My husband had the penne ariabatta w Italian sausage, I had the fruita de mare. Both were amazing. Seafood was very fresh and cooked to perfection. Arriabatta sauce had a wonderful ' heat' to it. Friendly, attentive staff, owner floats thru the tables making sure everyone was happy. Great place, will go back!
author: Chris M.

description:
This restaurant was on the list of suggestions and a 10% discount from our hotel.  We were hungry and in the mood for pasta so decided to try it out.  It was before 5PM when we arrived to find an empty restaurant which was great to receive attentive service and wait for food wasn't too long.  The restaurant has tables around the outer perimeter which provides viewing of the activities in the street and a few tables within.  The menu has a good selection of pastas and entrees, and we all ordered from the specials of the day menu.

Instead of cream sauce, I ordered the lobster ravioli and prawns with marinara sauce.  The prefer a little lighter sauce but it still tasted good with the ravioli.  Each ravioli was filled with lobster and there were 2 large prawns so definitely felt I got my money's worth.  I also appreciated the bread and butter that was received with our meal.  Our server refilled our waters, and brought us more bread.  

Good hearty meal to enjoy before walking through the streets of San Francisco.
author: Violet P.

description: They really try hard..... but they don't listen and they are tone deaf.  The chefs have it.  Great food!  But service is pathetic.  Gone.  Clueless.
author: Tomas S.

description: Can't say enough compliments about the food. So yummy!! Not your generic Italian-everything was FULL of flavor! Cute little atmosphere. I would definitely go back.
author: Samantha K.

description: It's definitely not the worst place I've ever eaten but I definitely won't be eating at this place again. The service was slow with only 2 other people in the restaurant and the food was just not at the level I expected from a place that serves "fine Italian food". Everything is overpriced so be prepared to be more for less. They had very fresh bread though!
author: Jasmine L.

description: Average Italian food, at best. Cramped and noisy, small portions, definitely not worth it.
author: Justin O.

description: Stopped in here for some lasagna and tiramisu. Overall service and experience was ok, but food was just so so.
author: James S.

description:
Good food. Could have been great, but was under-seasoned. Fresh ingredients. Calamari appetizer was the highlight and was fantastic!
Excellent service.
Good wine list.
Nice ambiance.
If the flavors were kicked up a notch, I'd go 4 stars. Until then, it's A-OK.
author: Charles S.

description: Had an exquisite meal here before attending the SF Symphony. Lamb shank with potatoes, carrots, onions and risotto. Absolutely delicious. They have a wonderfully quaint atmosphere, and a great ambience. Wished I'd had time for espresso and dessert.
author: Scott H.

description:
Overall good experience. This place is tiny. They have good pastas that taste as you would expect.  Good selection of wine. Nothing incredibly special but worth the visit. 

Cannoli - very hard to bite. The filling was pasty and you could taste the flour.  Skip it.
author: Diana G.

description: Delicious food, very generous portions, and great service at a price that isn't too high considering you're in San Francisco near Union Square. Be sure to make a reservation. Line around the corner when we walked out. Portions generous enough you could split an entree with someone.
author: Samantha C.

description: This place is awesome!  My wife had the Fettuccine Alfredo and I had the best Lasagna I have ever had!  Service was great!  Highly recommend checking this place out.  Looking forward to the leftovers
author: Chris D.

description: Cesario's really! A $20 minimum per person just to sit & have 2 desserts & 2 coffees & you snubbed us. You are terrible, especially the host Alex! Next review: Trip Advisor & every social media site! No where in the menu is there a $20 minimum. You are a disgrace & I will make sure everyone knows it. Tourist stay away, there are much better Italian restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Beliza G.

description: Cesarios was very close to my hotel room, so the location was vefy convenient. I ordered the calamari as my main dish, knowing I would not be too hungry after that, and then had the Tiramisu as my dessert. Both were equally as tasty. The calamari was fried and crunchy, the sauce was more of a neutral tomato based sauce. I regret not ordering a pasta as well, I think it would have been great. The tiramisu was so fluffy and a huge size, so I was impressed. My only pet peeve is that they put it on a strawberry filling which I don't think goes well with a tiramisu, but it's small enough to look past.
author: Sabryna L.

description:
We both had Paella and one had the chick sausage.  All of the food was good and the service was good considering they were really busy on a Friday night.

We are looking forward to returning.
author: R P.

description: Had a great dinner here with my wife. Prices were very reasonable and food was delicious. Staff was very friendly. Atmosphere was just what we needed after a busy day walking around the city--cozy and warm. I would certainly go back!
author: Carl N.

description: I hadn't been feeling well and didn't feel like 'going' anywhere, so we visited this place, which was adjacent to our hotel (Marines Memorial). I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food! The only significant drawback was the cramped space - as someone who mostly eats out in Manhattan, that's really saying something!
author: Amy C.

description: Very good. Swordfish special was delicious. Staff was knowledgeable, quick, and friendly. Pricing was good.
author: Wendy H.

description: Went here because they accept dining dollars through my school, and was pleasantly surprised. The food is actually pretty good. They do serve bread before the meal. but ours was cold and no butter, just olive oil. HUGE portions, and definitely expensive, although so is everything in San Francisco. It's a quaint, family friend atmosphere.
author: Ashton H.

description:
This place was amazing service was 10/10
Food was great and wine was great! Will def eat here again. Make sure you make reservations.
author: Joe J.

description:
Writing this in the hopes that management will read it. I asked the waitress if my dish was vegetarian since I am a strict vegetarian and always like to double check. She assured me that the dish I chose was vegetarian. I had a tasty dish, nothing super special, but when I started into the last third of it I saw what looked like a piece of meat. I had my boyfriend try it and he said it was unmistakably bacon. I lost my appetite but sucked it up and ate a couple more bites in order to try to not to be wasteful. 

When I informed the waitress of the kitchen's mistake, she apologized but brought us the check for the full amount. I was surprised because, though this doesn't happen often, whenever I've been in a similar situation at another restaurant, they have always gone above and beyond to make things right. Even in cases when something is slightly off, the restaurant will usually offer something to make up for the customer's displeasure. For example, a month ago I went to one of the other Italian spots I frequent in this neighborhood and noticed that the sauce on my pasta was different from the previous time I'd gotten it (there was a new chef and he/she didn't make it quite as well). They not only gave me a replacement entree at no additional charge, but to my delight also gave us a free dessert. I had only asked if the sauce had changed and had not even made a complaint nor expected any reparations, but the restaurant still made sure we were fully satisfied. 

I was very disappointed when I received the check for the full amount. I then asked the waitress to remove the charge for my entree, upon which she looked surprised and turned to the manager, who questioned the legitimacy of my claim and then proceeded to begrudgingly offer a 10 percent discount. To management: I live just a couple blocks from the restaurant and could have become a frequent diner. Imagine if you found something you find unappetizing in your food that you specifically asked not to have. Even if others might enjoy it, it really ruins your dining experience, regardless of whether you find it at the beginning or the end of the meal.
author: Lilia T.

description: I'm not one to write reviews on restaurants and I don't understand people who take time out of their lives to do it. However, the service here was by far the worst. My friend and I are touring San Francisco and we decided to stay around our hotel. We wanted a nice authentic Italian experience. You know the fancy stuff. But I could not believe the waitress when I told  her about how I did not like my eggplant Parmesan. It is my favorite dish and I order it everywhere when I eat Italian. But this was seriously the most distasteful one yet. I respectfully described to our waitress how I did not like it and I had only taken two bites. I assumed she would go and talk to the manager but she argued and did nothing. The food here is not close to being authentic and it  is way over priced for how its presented and tastes. If you're touring San Francisco I'd advise not to visit this place.
author: Jovana D.

description: House salad and Caesar was disappointing.  Poor quality greens.  Tuscan chicken too sour.  Service ok.
author: Kailua N.

description: Food is ok but the service is terrible. Went for brunch and watched my food sit under heat lamps for like 10 minutes while the server and manager walked around the restaurant cleaning. Won't go back.
author: Stomparella J.

description: Nothing special. It was our first night here in SF and kids were tired and hungry so we decided to give it a try. Expected better food in SF. Also the place was a little dirty IMO. Bread was soft...tasted like loaf of white sandwich bread. My biggest complaint is them charging 3% if using credit card. Who does that these days?!?! Go elsewhere. So many other better places in SF for Italian!
author: Wendy C.

description:
Just happened upon this fantastic restaurant ! Had the lobster ravioli! Incredible! And I am super picky, 
Staff is fantastic, cute place
author: Melissa R.

description: Outstanding ambience; quaint and charming while also sophisticated and superb location with fun city views. Wonderful service and food- without a hint of snootiness! We went after a long day of sightseeing with three tires children, and the staff were extremely accommodating. Would recommend in a heartbeat.
author: Mb B.

description: Honestly, initially skeptical, but delightfully "wowed" by friendly service, very good food and a reasonable price ($50) for SF. Had excellent Tuscan chicken-veggie dish, above-ave chicken Caesar salad, and eyebrow-raising carpaccio (yum!) to start. Space is tight. Arrive early or off-hours. Ask for window seat for street/people view unless have extraordinarily interesting partner and don't mind sharing your thoughts with strangers seated inches from you. Parking half-block up Sutter. Will return!
author: Mark M.

description:
Cesario's was not too far from my hotel so I decided to stop-by for a late lunch. 

The dinning room is not too big, the tables pretty close of each other, but at the time I went there was only 4 other patrons so I didn't mind too much. 

I really like the old school decor of the place. You can tell the place has been open for a long time and has a soul with a mix and match type of decor. 

The waitress was very nice and provided good suggestions for the menu. 

I ordered their Ceasar salad for appetizer and it was a massive dish! Well made, flavorful. Then for main I had the Fettucine Carbonara. Again a very generous portion with a lot of bacon, green peas and cheese. I could not finish both plates. 

Also good mention to their sliced bread served with pesto tapenade and olive oil.
author: Bruno G.

description: It was my first visit to San Francisco and I heard the food was amazing! So being Italian myself I asked my local hotel for recommendations and Cesarios was literally a few minutes walk. Amazing!!! The staff and Service were superb and  so on top of everything and polite! The food was amazing and so filling, the environment was beautiful and mellow. Thank you so much to the staff at Cesarios for being amazing! Look forward to coming back!
author: Mario Z.

description: Found this place on Yelp and so glad that I did!  Great little Italian restaurant. We were able to sneak in on a Saturday without reservations but it may be best to call ahead. The prices were reasonable as well. Waitress was very attentive to us and our food was delicious and served in a reasonable amount of time. The dessert was also fantastic!  This place is well worth the stop and I will definitely be returning when I come back to the city!
author: Marla W.

description:
I had the salmon picatta . It was very good! The salmon was tender and the vegetables were soft. I also received bread and butter for free.
My friend got chicken parmesiana and she said it was good. 
The service was very good. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by a polite gentleman that seated us right away.
The place was empty, but it was 2 in the afternoon. I thought the place was ok.

I would recommend this place to people who like ok Italian food
author: Melissa S.

description: Best penne Bolognese since I fell in love with it in Florence.  Biz colleague had the eggplant parm. Pear and walnut salad to start made it perfect. Window booth on the street added to the charm of the cozy little delight.  Would return in a heartbeat.
author: Garry W.

description: Horrible customer service, owner informed us we only have 50 minutes to order your food and leave as they have a party in there once we were seated and drinks provided. Most of the food was okay sub par to say the least. One of the males was completely horrible and wasn't eaten at all waitress never returned when she noticed the food wasn't even and was informed the food was horrible not even a manager bothered to come address the situation and we are provided our checks
author: Valerie H.

description: Ordered the polenta fries and shrimp carbonara for take out. The polenta fries were not fully cooked, kinda mushy, gooey and fell apart. Polenta fries are one of my favorites and these were a miss. The shrimp carbonara sauce was thin and runny like milk and bland. No salt or seasonings at all. Maybe they were having an off night, but I won't eat there again. I don't recommend.
author: Marshelle B.

description: First I would like to say that I don't normally write reviews but the experience we had tonight prompted me to write this one. We are from Texas and were looking for a good local close to our hotel place to eat on our last night in San Fran and found Cesario's.  We walked in and were greeted by an older gentlemen that asked if we had reservations. The place was full. We said no so he asked us to wait a few minutes. 5 minutes later he sat us down next to another couple with the two tables separated by 3 inches or so. It's like he created 2 two tops from a four top. This is exactly what we were looking for. The tables were squeezed in different directions like a jigsaw puzzle but we had plenty of room. The waitress was very attentive and took care of us really well. We ordered an appetizer Calamari and it was great. We then ordered the recommended specials of the night and they were delicious. Great portion size and full of flavor. Even the bread was delicious and fresh. The service was excellent! If you ever want to have some great Italian food try this place......it's some of the best you will ever have. We will for sure eat here again next time we are in San Francisco
author: Raul S.

description: Worst service EVER. I've been here once before and it was alright. I decided to take my mom here on a Sunday when the restaurant was absolutely dead-- literally, it was just my mom and I and one other couple. We waited AN HOUR for our food. I finally asked the waitress to check on it because I knew it shouldn't be taking that long if no one was in the restaurant. Turns out the owner (I think he's the owner) didn't even put our order in the system. When he learned of the mistake he wasn't even apologetic. We got up and left. Never coming here again.
author: Randa M.

description:
On a whim, my dining partner and I decided to try Cesario's because it was near our hotel.  Normally, I read reviews before venturing to a new restaurant but it was dinner time and we wanted to eat.  Small but cozy and a bit noisy.  Did not notice the music until the noisy group left and THEN, I heard Frank Sinatra, which all of a sudden created a different ambiance for me.  I felt I was back in the 1920's and about to partake in outstanding food.  Large, noisy groups do not do this gem of a restaurant justice.  I was happy to be there. 

The food was wonderful...my partner had the Pear Salad which took him a few minutes to finally eat because he said it was like a piece of art.  Everything in this salad was placed perfectly.  His chicken marsala was spiced just right, along with the cooked vegetables, which balanced the marsala.  I had the linguine al pancetta, which was in a light creamy sauce with a nice balance of pancetta, mushrooms and dried tomatoes.  I normally do not order creamy pasta dishes but I would order this again.

We visit San Francisco at least once a year and we look forward to returning to Cesario's.
author: Joye M.

description:
It's no Olive Garden, but Cesario's is my favorite low drama, family friendly restaurant at the intersection of Mason and Sutter.  The down to earth staff and classic Italian flare are noteworthy.

Unfortunately I recently stopped by around 3am to find a lack of late night options and the absence of a functioning drive thru.   See photo titled "No Drive Thru" for more evidence.
author: Nick M.

description:
We didn't eat lunch so stopped at this place for some pasta since we wanted something more filling.  On the "specials for the day" menu there was a lobster ravioli for $20 and lamb shank for $21.  They gave us fresh, warm sliced bread with a slightly sweet butter.  It was delicious!

The lamb shank was quite large and the meat was very tender and tasty.  It came with carrots, zuchini and mashed potatos.  Well worth the money.  The rest of us had the lobster ravioli which came in a Asiago cream sauce.  One of us ordered it with a marinara sauce which was also good.  Each plate had five ravioli but filled with lots of lobster.  We were full at the end of our meal.

I would recommend this restaurant although we didn't even notice what was on the regular menu!
author: Lisa C.

description: Food was pretty mediocre. The waitress we had made absolutely minim effort to serve us.
author: Keiko S.

description:
Just not even good... I had amazing sushi right don't the street. This place I ordered their classic spaghetti and meatballs , gross.. cold and nasty !!! Save yourself some money and just go eat some sushi done the street..

The server was rude! The owner was nice and kind ! But if you can't serve good spaghetti and meatballs then what are you doing ?
author: Viannet G.

description: Terrible. Told to wait 45 minutes..Fine..Then people walk up and get seated. When we ask what's up, we are told another 30 minutes..Pretty crappy for a place that's right near so many hotels.
author: jennifer f.

description: This was gross. Crammed and the menus says rock shrimp but reality it is bay shrimp. NO flavor. It's packed because it's on a corner next to a bunch of hotels. Don't waste your time.
author: Janet S.

description: I really enjoyed this place. We randomly found it on our first day here. The food was very good and the service was quick. Great first meal in San Francisco.  If your from Chicago, the prices for food are about the same comparably.
author: Tara G.

description: We were visiting San Fran for two days and ended up here twice...great food and a very great serving  staff! The food was amazingly! You must try the polenta fries, the Marsala and Tuscan chicken!
author: Erin H.

description: Lovely staff. Delicious food-- the polenta lasagna and truffle gnocchi are stand outs. Is frequently pretty popular and can be tight quarters, but worth it even if there is occasionally a short wait. I still try and go semi regularly, even after moving a few miles away!
author: R K.

description:
Great place, highly recommended by other and now by me... Food is delicious and with the correct portions.. 

El lugar es íntimo, muy recomendado por otros y ahora por mi, la comida es deliciosa
author: Albert R.

description:
I ate here with my co workers on our first night in the city. We had landed in the afternoon and wanted some quick and easy Italian sit down food. I ordered some bow tie pesto pasta with chicken (see pic) and it was exactly like what my 3 star rating says, "A-Ok". The chicken was overcooked and a little dry but the pesto and pasta were delicious. No one else in my group was blown away by their dishes either....all just seemed pretty average. 

The prices were fine....pasta dishes were $15-$20. I would not return or recommend the restaurant to anyone, with a city this big I'm sure there are plenty of other Italian restaurants that have better food for the price, we were just in a rush and wanted something close by! Service was fine though.
author: Kent V.

description: I had the opportunity to stay near Union Square and walked by Cesario's two nights in a row. They were busy both nights so I decided to try them. Had the penne bolognese and it was delicious! The servers are very friendly and accommodating. Would highly recommend.
author: Jocelyn P.

description: Very reasonable price ($20-25 a plate), nice location and has a relaxing vibe. The servers are attentive and on it when it comes to ordering, refills, etc. I'm not big on Italian food but this place is great. Olive Garden who? I'll take Cesarios instead!
author: Lucas M.

description: We were here on Monday (7/17) This place is just dirty! The food didn't taste fresh, the vegetables were chewy and looked old, poor quality of seafood and meat! The utensils were dirty!! The customer service was okay, although our waitress had really strong accent, so some things she was saying were hard to understand.. I don't know how restaurants can hire someone to serve their food when the staff can not speak clear! They offer a 10% discount but it's a trap! Never going back here for sure!
author: Margaret T.

description:
Cesario's is a solid option for a good, satisfying meal. The ambience is great, service is excellent, the portions are the right size, and the pricing was within expectation for the portion sizes. 

For vegetarians: this place has excellent vegetarian options. It has a large number of vegetarian pasta selections, a large number of vegetarian appetizers, and a few vegetarian entrees. 

I ordered a fettuccine with pesto, and requested that mushrooms be added on top (and they had no problem accommodating that request). The pasta was absolutely delicious - really well made. In addition, I found the risotto that I ordered to be excellent as well. 

Service was fantastic as well - really courteous throughout. I'd note though that the seating is very close together (this doesn't affect me, but it might be bothersome for some)

Note: I would call this more of a low $$$ than a $$ restaurant - expect to spend about $40-50 in all if ordering an appetizer/dessert, an entree/pasta, and wine.
author: Rohan S.

description: I get it we changed our reservations to 7 but the thing is my parents, sister and i were waiting outside for our god damn table for at least an hour. The manager had the fucking decency to tell the customers to hurry up because there were people that were waiting for their table. I really like this restaurant but the guy didn't do shit. He was just standing there looking around. The custmores on the other hand were done with their food, only their waters were on the table. I swear to god if next time this happens again i will go inside and do something about it. We were there to celebrate our mom's birthday. I am just so angry. If my mom didn't keep telling me not to go in there and if we weren't there for her birthday i would have gone inside and gave guy a piece of my mind. The fact that he didn't tell the customers that we were waiting pisses me off even more. I work in a restaurant too, i get it, it gets busy but if there were custmores who were taking a long time and someone else needed the table i would go up to them and tell them in a nice way "hey guys there are customers who have been waiting for a table for a long time do you think you can hurry up, they need it". I would have the decency to do that. But it just pisses me off so bad. I haven't gone to this restaurant in so long, i work practically every day managing the restaurant when my boss is not there, i don't get the time to spend that much with my family and i was really looking forward to it tonight.
author: Marina F.

description:
We were suppose to have dinner at a different restaurant but they were packed. My bf suggested we walk a block and see what's around. He randomly picked Cesarios Fine Dining. He said we should just go in since they didn't look busy at the time. 

Looking from outside, I saw a few old people and 1 young couple. I looked Cesarios on yelp and I wondered why it only had 3 stars in total. I was shy/hesitant to go in because it looked high class but I thought just give it a try. 

We walked in and immediately an elderly mannered man greeted us happily and sat us down. I was very pleased. One of the waitress who didn't seem to know much English smiled happily and asked if we wanted water.

Anyway getting to the point, our waitress was very nice and friendly but it seemed like she didn't know much about the appetizers and entrees. I asked her what was their popular appetizer and she told me the bruschetta. I asked more about it because I really didn't know but she didn't really explain. I asked her about the clams and she told me it was really good. I just went with my instincts and I ordered the clams. My bf ordered his favorite carbonara and I ordered my meat lasagna. 

Our appetizers, clams and soup of the day arrived at a good time. I liked their soup but after awhile it tasted like too much flour. The clams tasted ok at first but the sauce made it taste a little bitter. When our entrees arrived, it looked really delicious! I loved how it was nicely plated. I dug into my meat lasagna and the crusty cheese on top was really good. As I started to eat the middle part, I didn't like it. I don't really know exactly how lasagnas are made but this tasted like it was pre-made and then cooked or something. I don't know?!  The texture was hard and it just didn't taste right. I was a little disappointed. I didn't want to be mean so I didn't say anything. I took only a few bites. His carbonara was not bad. The sauce was pretty good but again heavy/floury taste. The bacon was salty. His was better than mine. Decent price but the food isn't as good as it looks.

I was going to give a 2 star but because staff was very accommodating, respectful, nice and friendly, 3 stars will do.

I would really love to come back after they make changes to the food :)
author: Sharmaine M.

description:
The food is amazing! Basically perfect.
I ordered the meat lasagna and it went beyond my expectations.
I also had the lamb shank. Flawless.
author: Anisa A.

description:
Great service and very friendly 
Fair prices
Quality food
Very clean 
Great old feel
Clams and mussels are very fresh
author: Cody M.

description: Probably great dining but could not seat 2 on Wen. Night Parking is a challenge and why after you have eaten do you not timely get up and leave. This is selfish and self centered. Plus it limits ownership a revenue stream.
author: Mr V M.

description: Overall good experience. Service and food were good. The only negative point is that the place is a bit small and the tables are too much on top of each other. Not much privacy when you eat.
author: Samantha O.

description: One of the best Italian restaurants in the city. Great ambience, amazing food, great service. They also have a great menu with dinner specials nightly.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Saw 4.5 review and were nearby, so we came in. Big mistake. A delightful, kind and cheerful waitress could not make up for 'Wonderbread' bread - soft, pure white and tasteless. We almost got up and left after the bread was served, and should have. Carpaccio was five times too thick, 'special' Gnocchi with truffles had no visible or detectable flavor of truffles. Eggplant parm. 
was flavorless and smothered in cheese. Mediocre at best. Accurate rating would be 2.8. - 3.3. Mostly bottom shelf wines to choose from, too. Overall, a Denny's version of Italian.
author: Reginald F.

description:
A simple but amazing late lunch. The ham and cheese panini was great! The avocado slices were fresh as was the focaccia bread. The hand sliced fries were just right with the perfect amount of crispness. I had a Peroni beer with this that went very well. I finished off with a nice hot cup of coffee. 

Very reasonable prices and good service. The atmosphere was great with early 40s Frank Sinatra as a lunch companion over the speakers!
author: Steven S.

description: Friendly staff, good food, and quiet. A nice change from some of the trendy places in the area. Definitely recommended for a nice quiet dinner.
author: Daniel T.

description: A quaint Italian restaurant, recommend getting a window seat and the frutta di bosco torte
author: Lauren R.

description: So fantastic feel so lucky to have happened upon this place ... You must try it out.....
author: Richard M.

description:
I really liked this place. The food was delicious. We were lucky enough to get a window booth. The owner was very sweet and friendly. The wait staff was a little cold, but it didn't ruin our dinner. They were just doing their job, nothing more, nothing less. The interior tables seemed a bit cramped, so I was relieved. We made reservations for 8PM on a Monday night and they were slammed.

We started with the calamari and it was good. It was what we expected. Good, but nothing to knock my socks off. It was the same calamari you'd get anywhere. We also shared the pear salad and it was DELICIOUS! I highly recommend it. Our main courses were really good too. I had veal and my husband had fettuccine. It was more than enough food. Then we had dessert. Any decent Italian restaurant has to have a good cannoli and this was no exception. It was exceptional. 

We left extremely full of amazing food. The service could have been a touch friendlier, but overall, it was a good experience.
author: Suzie K.

description: this place was terrible, ordered through yelp eats, when I got there, all they showed me was their fax machine printer was out of ink, made no attempt to call yelp. waited another 20 minutes for my food, only for the food to be terrible. I ordered chicken parm and the chicken was rubbery. The sauce was good, and that was about it. I do not understand how this place has such a high review.
author: Lindsey K.

description: This restaurant is a solid choice for anyone, local to the Bay area or tourist.  Food is delicious; restaurant staff is efficient -- well orchestrated service.  Only criticism is the proximity of the tables which makes for unaccustomed and challenging intimacy depending on where you're seated.  Even so, do not let this deter you from a great dining experience.  Prices are more than reasonable, almost unbelievable.
author: Patricia G.

description:
I came here for lunch with a friend, and it's a quaint restaurant. However, both the decor and service were on the borderline of being stuffy. The server was just friendly enough, but he never bothered to check on us.

I tried the salmon medallions with mashed potatoes, and my dish was very good. It was the perfect size for lunch, and it was a nice comfort meal.
author: Rachel H.

description: Visited on 10/10 and literally just passed by and it looked good.  Small place with small-ish menu but wonderful choices.  Husband had carbonara and I had penna bolognese.  Both dishes were very well made and tasted great.  Wine selections were very good too.  Recommend!
author: Karen B.

description: Excellent food, excellent service and great ambience! But don't eat here lest you take a table away from me LOL! Not many tables. Be sure to Open Table your reservation.
author: Tom K.

description: This place happened to be down the street from where we were staying. After having a long day of travel, we wanted to stay near by and after looking for something close by, this popped up. We were seated right away since we had made reservations on Opentable. The staff was very polite and attentive We ordered the Herbed Garlic and Parmesan Bread to start- it was very very good. We order the Butternut Squash Gnocchi and the Capellini Pomodoro. Everything was very simple but still made very well. We ordered the Spumoni Gelato and that was well worth it. We enjoyed the quaint little place, service, and food overall. A great option that was close by.
author: Dipangi P.

description: Food was mediocre at best, service was far below par. Servers have selective hearing (especially the manager). Make sure make them repeat your order back to you multiple times, or else you may end up not getting everything you ordered in a timely manner. Come here as a last resort.
author: Melanie J.

description: Wah wah wah. What do these reviewers expect, service for the Queen?  This place is located in a tourist district. EVERYTHING in the area is expensive. That's just the way it goes. The food was delicious. The service was excellent. And I feel the price was a little less than other restaurants in the area. Overall, would I eat here every night, No. but would I eat here when I'm in town, I like to try different places, but yes I would. Don't change a thing Cesario's.
author: Shirley Q.

description: Wow, so good we went 2 nights in a row.  Very good find here!  Puts a lot of the high end Italian restaurants here in Vegas to shame!  Try the Chicken Parm!  Kid friendly.
author: Victor G.

description: Cesaros is an Italian restaurant but they don't serve pizza! My favorite thing on the menu was the rock shrimp but I specifically ordered it fried so it was popcorn shrimp. Other than no pizza the place was good
author: Peter O.

description: Great service, authentic Italian food served very kindly but yeah efficiently. They treated me very well. The acoustics are very good, Ambience is  medium but the food is amazing and very affordable.
author: Mark D.

description: My husband and I split a Caesar salad to start, and that was excellent. We enjoyed the NY Strip steak and pasta with Alfredo for an entree. Splitting all of the above was plenty food for us, and it was fantastic. This place has a wonderful ambience at night and is perfect for a quiet dinner for couples. We loved it and would recommend it to anyone.
author: Valerie B.

description: Food is very decent and surprisingly delicious. Perfect place for a quick lunch when you're in this part of downtown.
author: Maricar F.

description:
While on a business trip, we ordered for some take-out to eat at our office for the week.

I ordered the Chicken Piccata.  It was decent.  Perhaps I was hungry.  The vegetable medley is your typical mix with squash, broccoli and carrots.  I also got some sort of rice as my side.  I took maybe 3 bites (one to try, two to make sure and three to finalize that I didn't like it).

As for the chicken, it was pretty good.  Not overly sauced, which is good.
author: Sedine S.

description:
I live close to this place and I was too busy so I decided to order delivery.
I ordered Linguine with Clams and Linguinie with Porchetta.
For two VERY SMALL entrees, it costs 45 dollars.
YES, forty five FREAKING dollars. 
Was it good?  NO.
author: Leslie M.

description:
What a delightful small restaurant. Personable service, fresh food, good portions. My husband had the lamb shank and I had spaghetti and meatballs. We shared tiramisu for dessert. 

The restaurant was full when we arrived and we started at a small table at the very back. When another table opened up, they offered to move us to the other table which was by the window and great for people watching.
author: Lori R.

description: The lobster ravioli was fantastic, and good prices are not crazy. The service was good. Get the cannoli
author: Michael K.

description: Got the linguine vongole with white sauce. I don't know why I did that. White sauce is over linguine vongole is never good to me. Good service though. They were closing the kitchen, but welcomed us in. My friend got the butternut squash ravioli and it was delicious. If you go, try to sit in Carolina's section. She's fantastic
author: Nick U.

description: I had not been here in a while. Marines memorial was closed on 12th floor so I had to come down here for a business lunch at 12:30. The place was clean, we were seated promptly and the waiter was observant that it was not just lunch but also an important meeting. He was very polite, have us space to conduct business and let us take our time. Did not feel rushed at all. Amazing service the food was great! And the bill was very affordable! I am coming back again and will be looking forward to the same service. Thank you to the wonderful older waiter that allowed me to have a great 2 hour successful meeting. Food was great also, 5 items and coffee we ordered was delicious.
author: Joseph H.

description: Great food and location.  Service was excellent also. After a long flight from the east coast it was close to the JW and hit the spot. Portions were large also which is hard to find in San Fran.
author: Joe F.

description: A solid 2. The food is mediocre and expensive. Best part of the meal was the bread with pesto olive oil.  For a cute little restaurant, in fun location one would think the food would be better. I wouldnt recommend this place. There's plenty more just a mile down the road!
author: Sean C.

description: Food was mehhhh. Ordered NY steak, medium well and it was pretty when it came out but the steak was medium rare or something, and it was cold already. Sad!!! My dad ordered well done, it came out medium. No flavor in the Demi glaze. Basil with olive oil for bread dipping was mehh also, it could use some salt. (I'm not the type to like salty things either). Oh yeah bread was a burned too. Like literally it was bitter. I didn't ask how everyone else's food. But no one finished their meal. So yeah I guess there you go. Friendly staff though! The place is small and cozy. Loved the atmosphere. Maybe I should've gotten pasta. Uhhh the regrets.
author: Diana A.

description: Stopped here when another restaurant was packed.  Glad I found this place. Pasta was very good,  great sauce and the veal was great.  The owner was very friendly and the service was good.
author: Ben H.

description: We ate here last night and the food and service was great! I had the lamb special and my wife had the lasagna. Large portions and cooked to perfection! The lamb was the meat off a lamb shank, but without the bone. Delicious! Roasted potatoes and carrots in a sauce complimented the meat perfectly! My wife said the lasagna was just like the old Italian restaurants in North Beach she remembered as a kid. The prices are also very reasonable, considering the location of this place. I highly recommend this place.
author: Philip S.

description: The Frutti de Mare with clams, mussels, scallops, shrimp, and swordfish on a bed of pasta with marinara sauce is my best meal this week in SFO.  Great meal at very good pricing.
author: Tony O.

description: Great food, especially for a place that delivers!  I got the pear salad and the veal marsala.  The pear salad came with mixed greens, pear slices, carmelized walnuts, blue cheese, and a champagne vinaigrette, and was absolutely amazing!  I would come back just for the salad.  The veal marsala was also pretty good, and comes with a choice of mashed potatoes, risotto, or polenta.
author: Cici A.

description: We initially decided to visit this restaurant since it was close and offered discounts to hotel guests. We were pleasantly surprised to find the food was excellent and house wine enjoyable! Would highly recommend the gluten-free pasta and penne basilica!
author: Karen B.

description: Minestrone was bland. The penne bolognese tasted like a weird form of chili with noodles in it. Even the house red wine was gross. Despite being polite I felt like they hated me with serving food like this.
author: Thomas H.

description:
Cesario's is a definitely one of the many under-rated restaurants in SF. 

Cesario's is a cute, small restaurant that offers great food and service. I came here with a group of 8 people and all of our food came out hot and around the same time. The dish portions are also on the larger side so they could be shared. 

The location is convenient and there are parking lots/garages near by (even street parking if you feel like looking). The ambiance/decor is a little outdated and the crowd seemed older.
author: Tania D.

description:
We were the first people in the joint on a Saturday morning. The waitress was so sweet from start to finish. I just wanted to bring that up first because she deserves a big shout out. 

We got a window booth seat with our backs against the wall so we could check the place out. A window seat here is highly recommended because the people watching is fantastic. 

At first we didn't think they had cocktails, but they do. My husband went with the Bloody Mary and the waitress talked me into the Pomegranate Mimosa. Talked me into it, Ha! so she thought. 

The waitress asked if we were interested in Breakfast or Lunch when we got there. I was in the lunch mood and the man was in the breakfast mood. 

So she had to provide two different menus. They should just combine the two and save some space. 

We started with an appetizer of Mussels & Clams. It was in a delicate tomato-y broth that was excellent with the bread provided. This isn't on the menu but it was one of the specials. 

I had the Grilled Chicken Club: Greens, Tomato, Prosciutto & Gorgonzola Cheese . It didn't have Prosciutto but it did have bacon and I looove me some bacon. 

I got a side salad and they have a yummy homemade dressing that was light and tasty. I don't like mixed green salads so much, well I hate red lettuce so I ate the green parts out with the tasty dressing. 

My husband got the regular Eggs Benedict. The eggs looked perfectly poached. He got a side of Fresh Fruit and it had Papaya, Honey Dew, Cantaloupe and Kiwi. A great fresh breakfast start, because I kept stealing pieces from his plate. 

About the time we were done the place started filling up with more customers. I recommend coming early so that the dining experience can be quiet and relaxing. 

Maybe Tom R. and Daniel L. should check this place out for their next brunch excursion?
author: Ivy R.

description: My friend and I came here for dinner and neither of us had a huge appetite. We ordered garlic parmesan bread and chicken Caesar salad. The food was honestly delicious. I also had a cosmopolitan which was also great. The service was fast and friendly and I hope that I come back next time I'm in the area!!
author: A Z.

description:
We stayed in a hotel close to Union Square and had been walking around the hood all week seeing people dining at Cesario's for the last few days.  The people had all looked happy and the food looked good.  We checked reviews and saw they were inconsistent, but we were hoping we'd get in on a good night, and gave it a try

It was a good night.  My  Linguine Ai Frutti Di Mare was fantastic.  The pasta was nicely cooked with a good texture.  The red sauce was spiced with enough to give it interest but not so much it interfered with the flavors of the seafood.  Th calamari and clams and mussels were seasoned and cooked perfectly.  Lots of fish--also some salmon and prawns.  Yum.  The portion was adequate for a very hungry person.

Service was kind and helpful.  The place is adorable. WIne was good.  prices seemed fair.  Best meal ever?  No.  But good, hearty, pleasant, and everyone had a great time and left feeling awesome.  What more do you want?
author: Leslie W.

description: With a little tweeking this could be 4 stars.  The first and last items are what lost stars for this restaurant.  This is San Francisco, home of the best bread in the world but here you get "white bread".  I was really worried when we got the bread to start.  However the salads and soups were great.  Of the five of us two had clam chowder and loved it, one had the pear salad and again really enjoyed it, two had ceasar salads and really liked them.  Dinner was also a hit, 2 Veal Parmesan, 1 Veal Marsala, 1 Polenta and 1 Lobster Ravioli and every one really liked their meal.  Then came dessert Oh Dear.  Sad way to leave a good meal.  The cannoli was like a block of cement filled with a sweet, sweet frosting - epic fail.  So skip the dessert and leave with a good taste in mouth.  The salad, soup and entrees were great.  The service was excellent.
author: Gaye G.

description:
Delicious and gourmet. Should have a higher overall review.

Delectable wine variety.
The seafood salad could have had more seafood in it. But what it did have was very good.


The service was 5 star. 

My dish was ravioli which was as filling as an Italian dish should be. It was delicious. Exactly what I was expecting. No special perks to the dish.
Simple.

My friend got swordfish. And that was especially delicious.
author: Karina G.

description:
Great italian chow!

Service by lovely Russian ladies and well managed.
Dined there four times this week.

Prices reasonable

Pest pasta superb as was the sea food

we had blacked sword fish

we will be back

Mahalo Nui Loa from Hawaii Hotelier
author: Patrick B.

description: Wife and I decided to spend news years day in Union Square. While wondering around after a few drinks at Bobs bar we were looking for somewhere to have dinner. We found the place right next to the Marine memorial club. It was Cesarios. At about 4 or so there was only two people in there but we decided to look at the menu anyhow. It looked promising. So we went in. I had the baked halibut and the wife had the chicken Marsala. I was very happy with both the taste and the portion size of my entree. The wife liked hers as well. The bread wasn't sourdough but was more like a Portuguese sweet bread. The dipping sauce was pesto in olive oil. It wasn't what I expected but was very good. We both had dessert. So 2 entrees, 2 cocktails, 2 desserts and coffee with tax came to less than $85. I though that was pretty reasonable for Union Square on new years day. I would definitely go back if we ever stay in that area again. We then went up the street to another bar and on the way back to our own hotel we looked in and every table was full.
author: scott c.

description:
Came in once during the day. Half empty small cozy dining area.

My lady and I asked if we could sit at the empty table near the window. 
Owner said that table is reserved. Alright. Sat at the different very tight table.

Waitresses are slow as hell. 

Food is less than average. I had a better tasting pasta at Carrow's. How hard is it to fuck it up? At this place they know how to do it.

Had a soup, 2 pastas and 2 wine glasses: $80 + tips!

While leaving, that table near the windows was still left empty.

Left $90. Will never be back.

The culmination of all this - Attenzione everyone! 
- they got 1 single bottle of oil and vinegar to share between tables! :)))


The worst "Italian" restaurant I've been to.
Want some real Italian food? Go to Columbus Ave., there are plenty of them.

1 star for the cozy decor only, which they lure people in with.
author: Alex P.

description: Went to dinner here after walking past it and seeing the menu cute small place great service and amazing food ! Only think that would of made it better would have been better bread!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
This is a great little Italian restaurant with great food.  My wife is vegetarian and there was plenty on the menu.

Friendly wait staff, prompt.  Good wine.  Didn't come over too often, and didn't leave us alone too long.  Great sense of timing, and for me that's almost as important as the food.
author: brian k.

description: We stay at the hotel next door quite often and on this occasion we decided to order food from Cesario's for pick up. The man taking my order on the phone was horribly rude but I thought once I went down to pick the food up it would be fine. I went down and there was a woman there who gave us the check but completely ignored making eye contact or greeting us.
