My husband tried to joke about eating the cheesecake on the counter and she rolled her eyes. We got our food and went up to the room. The mussels and clams were bland and tasted  fishy. I love mussles, I can rarely say that I have had bad ones. The pasta we got was absolutely awful. Plain pasta noodles with generic tomato sauce. It literally tasted like tomato sauce out of the can without seasoning. No garlic, no salt, no pepper. Nothing. So disappointed. From the service to the food.
author: D T.

description:
We went to this place last Thursday night and all I can say was it was terrible.  I mean really really terrible. NONE of the pasta is fresh or home made (we asked and were told 'no we don't have the time to make pasta')

The food we did was was burnt and cold... Not sure how you really manage that, but hey.

We told the waitress we didn't really like the food (we also didn't finish it) and we paid the bill and reduced the tip accordingly.

We won't be going back and I would never recommend this place.
author: Mike W.

description: We arrived around 12:40 pm. Only one table was occupied.   We were seated promptly at a booth table.  Water was served.  Bread with olive oil too.  We had the polenta fries which came with tomato sauce.  My friend had the veal, side polenta, and veggies.  I had the special lunch which is clam and mussel linguini.  For dessert, cannoli and tiramisu.   Service was good.  Will come back to try their other dishes.
author: E. C.

description: I've been here many times and the food is always excellent. This time I went, they had discontinued my favorite dish which was the Salmon Medallions but they did a special salmon dish for me. It was really good but done a little more than I wanted but it was still very good. They put together a wonderful dairy free sauce and gave me ample steamed veggies without any butter. I took home a dish of the Eggplant Parmesan and my honey enjoyed it for lunch the next day. A great little spot that I have been going to for at least 2 decades and they just keep producing delicious dishes, putting smiles on diners faces and servicing customers pleasantly. The service is always excellent and right on the mark.  The Polenta Lasgana is also an amazing dish. I don't eat it because all of the yummy cheese and dairy but I did taste it and it's really delicious!!
author: Kercy A.

description:
I ate lunch here today. This is a very charming small Italian restaurant with a nice corner location---great place to people watch. I had the spinach salad and Tuscany chicken and both were excellent. The service was very good and my waitress was both friendly and attentive.
I will eat here again.
author: James M.

description: It was a great restaurant experience for my family. We go to Union Square in December and end up spending a lot of money and not always getting a lot for it. However, we had a quality experience at Cesario's. First, we forgot what time we had made the reservation yet the host was very friendly at the door and accommodated our earliness. The waitresses were very helpful and efficient in taking our order and explaining the menu. The environment was warm and fun with lots of Christmas lights and pictures on the wall. The food is not at all bland as some other reviewers claim if you want classic Italian food. We had clam chowder. Then spaghetti and meatballs- a large portion split between my daughter and I which was very good.  My husband had ravioli Florentine which was much more delicious. We both had a glass of wine and dessert. The bill was under $100. Nice warm environment and excellent food at a very affordable price. We will return.
author: Chris T.

description: Wow, that was terrible. I seldom leave Yelp reviews, but I logged in before I even left the restaurant to leave this one in the hope that nobody should have to suffer that overly salted, weirdly textured horror show they call chicken parm ever again. Stay away. Far, far away.
author: Ruth S.

description:
From the mind of a kid
Lots to say bit where to begin, let's start with the service, water and bread came almost instantaneously as we say down but the refills took longer than I had wanted it took a whole ten minuets for them to re-fill my cup with sprite. During the period between ordering and getting the food not one staff member cared to update us about where our appetizers were. To start we had the polenta fries and they were amazing, crispy and fluffy like a deep fried cloud. Recommended to anyone who likes food even if your not the hugest polenta fan. Now for the entree, I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo and it was very good and the whole table ate the entirety of it. Also at the table was: chicken Parmesan, linguine with clams. And spaghetti  and meatballs, all very good and all pricey. Very nice experience
author: Max B.

description: I usually don't write reviews for good or bad restaurants. If i dislike the service or food from a certain place i simply don't ever go there again. However, today i had one of the worst experience that I've ever had in my life when it comes to dining at Cesarios Restaurant. I decided to invite my best friend out for dinner as a birthday celebration which was a complete failure due to the customer service we received. We arrived at the place and the waitress did greet us and asked how many of us were to dine in. We told her it was 2 of us and she said there were no tables at that time but the wait time was about 15 min. We agreed to wait as we were the only party waiting for a table at that time. Minutes later a couple (two American  women) arrived and the manager seated them immediately although we were still waiting and they had no reservation. Then again another couple who looked American arrrived to the place and the manager managed to seat them before us too although they had no reservation either. It was then when i decided to question the waitress and told her that we had arrived first and how come we have not been seated yet. Her response was that they both had reservation and then thats what got me pissed and i  told her that i was standing by their side and had heard that neither of them had reservations. Then she responded that it was her manager who was sitting the people and she didnt know what he was doing! Then the manager came and i told him that we had been waiting  to be seated and his ignorant response was " I'm sorry they were seated because they  are regular customers"    are you kidding me?? So no one else but the regulars have preference. Honestly, this has been one the worst places i ever have even dine in. And the manager is one of the rudest persons i have ever encountered in my while life. My advise is if you dont want to be  targeted as a nonworthy customer, then dont dine here because everyone that works here especially the manager is RACIST.
author: Manuela R.

description: Excellent bolognese,fresh ingredients,nice atmosphere. Portions are small. Tiramisu was fantastic.
author: Frank D.

description: The location is convenient when one is in the area. The food was average. The highlight was pesto that is offered pre meal. It was fresh with right the ingredients.
author: Aly A.

description: If you are looking for authentic Italian food you may be disappointed. Let me first say we did not have reservations and got the last available table. I personally  find the bread served with meals to indicate the quality of food to follow. The Italian bread did not fit my standards;  it was not crusty and was over processed. We had a fried calamari appetizer and it was ok-nothing special with canned artichokes and a clump of wilted, undressed mixed greens. We were seated next to the kitchen and smelled someone cleaning something in the kitchen area--instead of an aroma of garlic and olive oil, we smelled Clorox---not appetizing!  I ordered penne melanzane --penne was perfectly done to al dente but sauce was sweet. We also had pasta carbonara which was  too creamy, bacon instead of pancetta (although menu did say bacon) and cheese used was not the Romano cheese I know. Restaurant was full but, having lived in Italy for many years, we would not return.
author: Kathleen A.

description:
The halibut was out of frozen and non-fresh fish, and in general we didn't like the quality of the food. 
The service was terrible - never met such a rude waitress in my life. She kept trying to take the salad plate I was working on probably 3 times. Ok, come on, just leave it, there is fork and knife sign that should tell you when I'm done! And you don't have to ask 100 times if we want to take that to go - we just said we didn't like the smell. 
The only reason why I am giving 3 starts - is the owner/manager that came up and apologized that we didn't like the food. And they deleted the fish from our bill.
author: Shahla M.

description: We found this restaurant by chance and decided to give it a try for dinner. The ambiance was great, very cozy and warm. The food was excellent and the service impeccable! We had a fantastic time there and it is now in our list of favorites in San Fran.
author: Ardy G.

description: We wandered in here for dinner around 9:30pm on a holiday.  We were seated right away in their cute friendly dining room with big picture windows.  We ordered a pasta - the penne bolongnase and the secundi - veal saltimbucco - both were done perfectly and the service was good.  Don't know why their yelp average isn't higher and fyi our bread was served with oil (so there was zero chance of butter re-use - as I saw suggested in another review I read ;)
author: Asaf P.

description:
Had the chicken picotta it was excellent 
With polenta yum
Ravioli jn cream sauce yum and pasta 
All wonderful and I am coming again soon! Our server jenny was helpful and gracious
A keeper for sure
author: Jen S.

description: After searching on Yelp for a place to eat, I came across this place.  The inside is small, but in a good way. The atmosphere was cozy. Right away we were seated. We got a nice table by the window with a view. Our order was promptly taken. The food came out quickly. I ordered the lasagna and it was very good. When dessert was offered I ordered the creme brûlée. It was very good. I enjoyed every bite. I left dinner very satisfied and happy.
author: Jackie R.

description: I really enjoyed my linguine vongole...tons of steamed clams in a yummy butter wine sauce
author: Jan F.

description: My husband and I just love this place, such awesome food i mean amazing.. and fantastic service!!!
author: Debbie C.

description: My first time at this cozy little Italian restaurant. Some upgrades could improve the food. The calamari has a lovely flavor. Served with a flavorful tartar sauce and marinara sauce (tomato sauce straight out of the can). I prefer marinara so would have enjoyed more with a good sauce. We had a paella with risotto. Nice flavor but a little dry. My pear salad had tasteless pear and tomato slices. The dressing on the greens had a good flavor but nothing special. The parmesan garlic bread could have used a little more garlic. Overall, I wouldn't return with so many other great places to eat in San Francisco.
author: Tracey L.

description: So good! I had the bruschetta and then fettuccine with clams & mussels in a white wine sauce. It was all delicious. Love the atmosphere in the restaurant and will definitely be eating there next time I'm in the city.
author: Molly J.

description:
Came here last night with my boyfriend because we both decided that our cravings for Italian food had to be satisfied immediately. I never realized the lack of Italian restaurants downtown, until last night, so our pickings were slim. We picked Cesario's because it was the only place nearby, but it looked really cute and we've walked by it a few times since we both worked downtown.

The waitress who I guess was Russian, was actually really nice and attentive to the both of us. She suggested a nice white wine for my boyfriend that was too sweet for me, but he thought it was tasty. She kept refilling my water cup and playfully asking why I didn't want to drink any wine! It was an awkward exchange, but I think she was just trying to make pleasantries throughout the night.

I ordered the Linguine Smoked Chicken and it was really delicious. It's hard for me to finish a whole plate of food usually, but in this case I like... devoured everything. Boyfriend got the "Gambretthi" or something like that, which had some yummy tiger prawns and a creamy white sauce. We both were thoroughly satisfied and would eat here again because our dishes stayed hot and cheesy til the last bite!

OH!!! and in our haste to leave the restaurant I'd forgotten my favorite scarf in the seat next to me and was super bummed when I realized it the next morning. Went there the next day and the host had it in the back and recognized that is was mine right when we walked in. That was nice and showed that they pay attention to their customers and who comes in and out!
author: Ariele M.

description:
My chicken parmesan? Sauce looked and tasted like the sauce in Chef Boyardee Spaghettio's and didn't taste much better and made the chicken look orange in color.  The cheese I'm not sure of its origins.

Stay away!
author: Mike M.

description:
Had reservations for 7:30 with my friend and was running late. I called in and let them know and they were alright.

It took forever to get our orders taken, which was agonizing since we were both starving. We started off with the polenta fries. I ordered the chicken parmesan with mashed potatoes. I can't remember the name of the dish my friend ordered but it was spaghetti noodles with sun-dried tomatoes and shrimp in a "light cream sauce."

The polenta alone took 20 minutes to come. Very annoying. And four pieces for $7? Ugh, I was expecting more. Oh well. It was too hot and burned my tongue but once I let it cool down, it was pretty standard fare.

Another 10 minutes and our food was there. My chicken parmesan was the best I'd ever had, to be perfectly honest. Good consistency for the meat and the marinara sauce was just right in terms of flavor. Vegetables were steamed well. One thing that was strange was that my mashed potatoes were under my chicken--what? Oh well.

Service was kinda hands-off--our waitress didn't come by to ask how we were doing at all. She was pleasant though, and the place was busy, so it's not a big deal.

For two dishes and an appetizer we were set back $55. I guess that's standard for a place that advertises itself as having "fine foods."

Sure, the food was good, but the service didn't live up to my expectations. For the same price I got better service at another Italian place in the Inner Richmond area. If I'm in the area I guess I'll go back, but maybe at a different time.
author: Beatrice C.

description: Great service. Visiting San Francisco and staying near union square - we so enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. My lobster ravioli was amazing.
author: Lisa H.

description: I stayed next door at the Marine Memorial Club and was too lazy to go far. I was extremely pleased with my decision . I had a halibut special with veggies and risotto and my wife had chicken piccata. Both were excellent. The wine list is  more than satisfactory and the service perfect. We will be back.
author: Ronald B.

description: We were staying at Union Square. We wanted Italian but the restaurants on Union were booked until late. We walked two blocks to this place. It was as good if not better than the restaurants on Union Square. Service was amazing. The food was what you would expect at a quality San Francisco establishment.
author: kandt p.

description: Cesario's was recommended by a friend, so we decided to give it a shot.  Walking up, we got a bit worried because it looked dated, but thought old charm might equate to good food.   Wow - were we wrong.  It was one of the worst meals I have had in a long time.  First off was the in house baked bread - terrible.  We usually ask for more bread because we both love it, but this was so dry and tasteless, we each took a bite and left the rest on our plates.  We both ordered basic dishes (Bolognese and Pesto Cream), but neither of us liked ours. We only had one night in San Francisco, so we were so disappointed to have a bad meal.
author: Lisa L.

description: They reuse the butter from tables..I know because I was an employee. I find that does not meet health code in my eyes. That's my only complaint though. And a reason why I no longer work there.
author: Julia D.

description: So many things wrong with this place. Terrible service, mediocre food. We ordered two martinis, after 10 min waiting the server told us it's going to be another 15min to get the drinks. They missed the salad in our order and at the end charged the wrong bill on outlet card. Had to wait 30 - 40min for the manager to show up and cancel the charge on the card. The manager didn't even come to our table. We had to finally get up and approach him to get resolution. Really horrible management.
author: Dimo D.

description: Great food and value and the staff was very attentive. The Veal Parmesan and Fettuccine Alfredo were great.
author: Lonnie N.

description: Cesario's feels tired. The wall next to my table was stained and needed fresh paint. I was annoyed by a little flying insect that kept circling over my food - looked like a fruit fly.  The food is definitely old-school.  I had a Caesar salad and Chicken Marsala with sautéed vegetables and polenta.  It was all fine, but nothing stood out as better than any of SF's many other Italian restaurants.  Service was quick and efficient.  The location is convenient to theaters and hotels, but I feel there are better choices in the neighborhood.
author: Paul F.

description: I enjoyed my linguine vogole (linguine with clams) but unfortunately there was mud in one of my clams which got all over the rest of the plate. My waitress was kind to take the dish back and ask the kitchen to remake the dish but by the time the dish was made, 20 minutes had passed and the rest of my group had finished their meals. I was surprised when the bill came the manager/waitress didn't offer to take the $18 dish price off the receipt. I paid the bill, but disappointed they didn't offer any compensation or offer a discount for the dish.
author: Martie A.

description: Wow  the veal picatta is 5 stR. Fettuccine Alfredo top of the best.  Large portion.  Great service.
author: Steve n lisa K.

description: The first warning was the waiting dish: pesto and bread roll. The roll was not very fresh, but worse, it was a sweet bun, together it tasted weird. We ordered squash ravioli and Tuscan Chicken. The ravioli were fine, sauce was creamy and perhaps a bit too sweet, but all in all we were satisfied (the only reason why I give 2 stars, not 1). The other dish (Tuscan Chicken) was a total disaster. Chicken breast looked microwaved (no marks of searing that gives the meat the flavour) and a bunch of accompanying vegetables in a thin sauce were so densely peppered with capers that the whole dish was overwhelmingly tasting like the caper pickle and nothing else. Overall waste of time and money.
author: Grzegorz J.

description: The place is tight and cramped but it was fine.  One advantage, you get to see what people ordered.  The plates are huge and one entree will probably be enough for an average person, unless you take a doggie bag.  I had the special: spicy sausage pasta.  I was so hungry that I devoured every bit of it.  We all cleaned our plates so that is always a good sign.  My friend said the chicken garlic pasta was not very garlicy.  The risotto looked good.  I'm not a fan of salt, so this place was good in my salt meter.  Some days you just want a big bowl of pasta, so this is the place to have one.  The service was slow in the beginning, only because there are only two waitresses in the whole place.  Can't fault them for that.  They were attentive and came back to ask if we needed any and water was filled.  If you have a big party, make a reservation or else be patient in waiting.  Such a small place doesn't make you want to stay too long.  I'm amazed that they put a table right next to the door (that's how cramped they are), but you just get really good Italian food!  Thanks to a friend for this recommend and our yearly holiday get-to-getter.  Happy Holidays everyone. I have to give kudos that they place literally will warm you up.  The kitchen is the natural warmer.
author: Helen L.

description:
Hungry after a gallery event we turned to Yelp.  We found something good and headed that way, figuring we'd be OK without reservations on a rainy Saturday night.  Wrong, there was a long wait.  They suggested the hotel concierge could assist, he recommended another Italian restaurant.  Alas we didn't Yelp...

In stark contrast to the first restaurant, Cesario's was not even half full.  We soon found out why.  We ordered beef carpaccio and two fish entrees.   We waited and waited.  Finally the two fish dishes arrive.  We asked about the carpaccio.  It was another server, she said she didn't know about it.  We said, it's fine, we'll just skip it.

The seared swordfish was incredibly overcooked, the salmon was also overcooked but not quite as badly.  The waiter did not come back to check on us, no one did.  After a while I decided to try and eat the swordfish as I was really hungry.  Still not once did anyone come by.  After eating the vegetables and the thicker parts of the fish, which was difficult as it was cut very thin (1/4" or so - I'm not exaggerating) I stopped.   Someone finally did come by to ask if I wanted a box!  

I said I didn't want a box, I wanted to see the manager.  We waited and waited.  Finally he came over, it was the man who had taken our order.  He apologized about the missing carpaccio.  We said that was fine, accidents happen, but the swordfish was way overcooked.  He said we should have said something, I said you didn't come back and no one else checked on us and we were hungry.  He said that  he manages two other restaurants and had to leave.

He then made a big deal about not charging us for the carpaccio.  How generous not to charge us for food we hadn't been served!  I said that was not the issue, the overcooked food and poor service was.  As someone who greatly values both I was quite offended that he wasn't concerned about our dining experience. 

Sadly, it was only when I mentioned that we weren't tourists, we were locals and it was important to do a Yelp review that he seemed to care at all.  Then he offered to take the swordfish off the check. 

I see that Cesario's has a three star rating on Yelp which is generous.  I just looked up the other restaurant  he went to check on Persimmon and I see it has two and a half stars, that's probably generous too.
author: Kara H.

description:
Okay food, average value. We were seated but not approached for 10 minutes, until our menus were closed. Waitress said we now looked ready to order. How about a cocktail first?!  
Food came quickly. Vegetables with meals had a Birds Eye vibe.  Risotto side filled with mushrooms. My husband is allergic and no mention of mushrooms on the menu. Waitress disappeared after service. When she finally reappeared we asked for mashed potatoes. Took another 10 minutes and by then we were all finished. My Pompodoro was excellent. My son's veal was also good. 
However, we wouldn't return.
author: Amy B.

description: Great food, horrible service! My fiancé and I shared a booth with another couple -  very odd and rather uncomfortable. When we requested another seat, we were denied. Our waitress was extremely rude, and it felt as if she was just rushing to get us out! Despite how good the food was, the service does not make it worth going back.
author: Anne E.

description: We arrived around six and were the first couple for dinner that evening. Sorta of made use nervous that there was no one else in restaurant. Within 15 minutes the place was full. We both ordered a veal dish which was delicious but slightly tougher than we are used to. Over all great food and service.
author: Randy H.

description: I had the special penne pesto with chicken and it was very good and extremely filling
author: Maxfield A.

description:
The food was OK but the waitstaff seemed confused as to who was covering our table.
The couple behind us was going to be shown a table although we had been waiting 10 minutes before they came in. After being seated no one came to wait on us. finally someone came but didn't bother asking for my drink order.After requesting s second glass of wine that never came either and when asked why to someone who finally came, were told that we should not have requested it from a different waiter. Not a good experience all in all.
author: Robert M.

description: The food is amazing. The service is really good. The butter that comes with the bread was way too sweet for my liking and the tables are tiny.
author: Jamie M.

description: Perfectly cooked pasta in a delicious cream sauce shouldn't be under appreciated. The service was fast and friendly. The only negative was the rubbery calamari - skip that and you'll probably have a great meal.
author: David M.

description:
The look and feel of this place is great. Sitting in the window seat, especially on a rainy night like we did, was very relaxing. At least on the night I was there (weekday and raining) there was hardly anyone in the restaurant and it was perfect for having a meaningful conversation with someone.
The food is so-so for Italian. I would go for the pasta instead of one of the meat dishes next time. 
Go here for the atmosphere and the location up the hill from union square.
author: Brendan D.

description: I wish I would have written this right after our trip, but there was just no time! All I can say is that I have been here a few times now and just appreciate everything about it. The location, the neighborhood feel, the friendly staff, and of course the consistently good food. Price is always under what I expect, which can be so refreshing in San Francisco. I will go here whenever I am back in the city, it's sentimental now :)
author: Jayne T.

description: We stayed in the hotel above this place and just wandered down because we were hungry. We didn't have reservations but they made room for us anyway. Linguini Carbonara was to die for! Dessert was heaven! Flourless chocolate cake with a chocolate mousse almost made me cry it was sooo good. Very lovely little place.
author: Stacia S.

description: Great little "find" just off Union Square. Really enjoyed the meal and the ambiance is great. "Neighborhood" restaurant.
author: Scott M.

description:
Had a dinner meeting here.

The location is good and the service was excellent. 

Appetizer:

Bruschetta Classica - served usual, nothing out of the ordinary here.

Entree:

Pollo Marsala - 
Ling Carbonera - This was delicious and not made with heavy whipping cream, so the taste was truly unique.

The meal total was about $50, but the experience was definitely worth it.
author: Marc M.

description:
After a tiring yet fun day hanging out in Muir Woods my friends and I headed to the city in pursuit of yummy Italian food. Unfortunately we didn't do our research ahead of time and kind of got lost a bit looking for parking and ended up in the Union Square area. After looking on yelp for some close by restaurants since by then we were starving, we ended up here at Cesario's. 

Our reception and service here was very cold first of all. I think our waitress never did crack a smile and neither did the host. The waitress was efficient but not welcoming. I felt like I was intruding in the restaurant even though I was there to give them patronage. Super weird. At one point we removed a huge candlestick in the middle of our table since we couldn't see each other when we were talking, and the host came back a few minutes later noticing it was moved and without saying anything or asking us if it bothered us, he just moved it back. 

The food was tasty and satisfied our carb craving at the time. Albeit a bit pricey, we came in here knowing that we would probably be forking over more money for the location of the restaurant than for the price of the actual food, and of course we were right. 

Won't be back even if we end up lost in Union Square again. God willing next time we will plan our city adventure better and look up where to eat ahead of time.
author: Saliha B.

description: The food here is absolutely delicious! The staff is very nice also. I eat here every time I visit SF. The butternut squash ravioli is very good and the creme brûlée is the best I've ever had. Prices are really good too and reasonable.
author: Abby S.

description:
I like this place.
I like the décor.
I like the people.
I like the menu.
I like the food.
I like the service.
My dinner (salad and seafood) was good.
Basic salmon piccata entrée with a seafood salad.
Everything tasted simple and fresh, (I almost feel like giving another star for that).
The salad was good, the entrée was pretty good.  Fish and veggies were done the way that I like.  
Fish cooked moist but flaky.  Veggies crisp and warm.  The chef cooks properly, but simply.  I would have made the garlic recipe with a lot more garlic, but still not bad.  
Torn between 3 and 4 stars, could really go either way.  
Food quality certainly merits a fourth star.  How small and dense that the place is felt three star.  (Im claustrophobic).  
This is not an easy review, but I am staying with 3 stars because that is how it felt to me.  A higher review would certainly be justified but not ready to claim fan status with a fourth star yet.  
Probably more visits could tip the scales one way or another?  
Ah, but there are lots more adventures out there awaiting my palate.
author: Veronica S.

description:
**Delivery Review**

I like the food here but it takes about 1.5-2 hours for it to arrive when seamless says 30-45 minutes. I've actually tried ordering from here twice (because the food was good) to give them the benefit of the doubt, but the food came so slow both times. 

I called after an hour to find out where my order was and before even taking my name, the man told me that it would be here any minute. Then I asked him when the driver left with my food, he asked my name and said "yes, it will be there any minute". I asked him what time the driver left and he said that they do not keep track of these things. So clearly, he knew for sure that my food would be here any minute. 45 minutes later, my food arrived, cold.
author: Michelle V.

description: Pretty small/ packed restaurant. Decent food, definitely nothing special. The staff also seemed slightly unorganized. 90% of the patrons at the restaurants were tourists. Not a bad tourist spot, but any local can do much better.
author: Lauren P.

description:
The decor was extremely nice, a throwback to Sinatra's time.  The maitre d was polite and seated hubby and I quickly.  The waitress was quite efficient, but put in the wrong order for hubby simply because I'd asked him if he didn't really want that.

Usually, you can tell a good Italian restaurant by its bread.  And, while not bad, this was grocery store cheap bread.  In a city renowned for its bread, this in and of itself is almost unforgivable.  But even worse, the bread was served with butter, not seasoned oil as is also customary in good Italian restaurants.

Our calamari was both a bit rubbery and undercooked.  But the homemade "tarter" sauce was quite good (and doubled as a salad dressing for the assorted greens that came as a garnish).  The breading seemed fine, crispy and not overly salty.

Now I'm not an Olive Garden person.  In fact, I flatly refuse to go to one.  And there are extremely few Italian restaurants even in the Seattle area that I will go to.  Still, it's also hard to compare to Grazie, a fantastic Italian restaurant not only in Tukwila, but in a strip mall in Tukwila!  But in a city like San Fran with a big Italian population, I really thought it'd be gotten right.

So I actually really loved my meat lasagna which also had spinach in it and was served with the subtly but nicely flavored veggies, apparently cooked in white wine.  But hubby said it was like a giant ball of cheese.  And his frutti di mare, which, despite my dislike of most types of seafood (apparently with squid one of the exceptions), I thought had a delectable finely tuned sauce, albeit as thin as soup, which sat upon the linguine like a fine watercolor, each color distinguished from the other, but subtly blended together.  In a bowl worthy of a large serving of pho.  Hubby, while he did like it, did not like the soupy sauce; it pretty much ruined it for him.

Lastly, the cheesecake, served with strawberries, whip cream, and drizzles of chocolate, was good.  Not great.  But good.

But, really for these prices, I can't in good conscience highly recommend this place.  Tourists, venture out away from this neighborhood, disregard the 10% savings (which is at least what one hotel provides for its guests).
author: C B.

description:
Lovely, small restaurant about two blocks from Union Square. Service was impeccable, unobtrusive and prompt. 

He had mussles appetizer, some of the best ever. His meat lasagna was not quite as good but he still managed to eat every bite. I had a delicious pear and pecan salad nicely dressed, followed by a ymmy seashell pasta gorgonzola. Very tasty and creamy. Dessert choices were excellent, i had a too-rich chocolate mousse cake, his cannoli were absolutely perfect. Don't skip the cannoli. 

Other diners included several couples, a single diner, and a dad with a small girl. Warm, neighborhood atmosphere. Overall, highly recommended - especially for a theater night.
author: Ellie P.

description: Great little restaurant, we got sat fast .The food was amazing , what kinda killed the mood was all the servers they were rude and didn't seem happy at all , might need some new servers to make a 5 star restaurant.
author: Zara K.

description: Came to lunch here with a group of four. We all ordered a glass of wine,  and then got caught up. When our server came back we ordered a variety of appetizers and entries. Everything was delicious, seasoned great, and just the right portion size. Now when our bill came it was almost  $200. So my friend and I split it, and he said "let me leave the tip." As he makes way more than I do. So I agreed. I drew a smiley face on the tip line, as I had a wonderful experience. Now the BAD!!! And this will be the only reason I am writing this review. I checked my bank statement while I was on vacation, and I noticed that who ever closed my ticket, added a $27 dollar tip to my half of the bill. So then I called on my vacation, talked to some who took down my name, number, credit card info, and a quick note of the incident. With no response within two days to fix the problem, prompted me to warn others. Be careful eating here, because they will obviously tip them selves whatever they feel they want. Needless to say, I will not be going back. Neither will my friends who come up from socal, and eat there every time there in the city.
author: Jonathan H.

description: We stopped in on our way to a show. No reservations on New Year's Eve. Luck was with us. We got the only table available. The food was delicious. Best eggplant parm I've ever had! My husband devoured to Lazzagna. Nice, old country ambiance and good service.
author: Helen G.

description: The food is just OK and the espresso terrible. An american restaurant but definitely not Italian.
author: David C.

description:
I ordered a mixed green salad to start. The balsamic dressing was terrible, too heavy for the leaves making the salad wet. For the entree, the reason I came, I'd  sought butternut squash ravioli. It was cooked in a very bland almost flavorless red sauce with fruit flies on the side.  No sage. And even though the sever offered the other table Parmesan she didn't offer any to me. When I asked for it she stated brusquely that I hadn't wanted extra cheese on my salad. 

Skip this spot, there is great Italian food around the city!
author: Sarah A.

description: Oh my!! One word-perfect.  After a 13 hour day this was the perfect way to end the day. From start to finish everything was flawless. The salmon was perfect. Salmon can go horribly wrong but this was cooked to perfection. The Pinot sauce was just the right amount. The wait staff did not miss a best. They worked in tandem with each other to provide seamless service. A perfect way to end a very long day.
author: rebecca k.

description: Mediocre food, setting and service. Our waitress looked like she was on the verge of a breakdown and then disappeared. The replacement was not much better, aside from seeming a little more stable. The food was extremely average (bread to start? What up with that stuff? Just buy something decent to serve...) May have been an off night, but I have a hunch you can find better...
author: Scott F.

description: Had an okay sandwich for lunch.  Service was quick. Food was so-so.
author: Dave G.

description: Cesario's is a small family owned restaurant located beneath the Marine Memorial Hotel and Club.  My favorite dish is their Caesar salad.  The portion is generous and the dressing and Romaine lettuce is always fresh.  The service is impeccable and prompt.  It's a great spot for lunch or dinner before or after a busy day of shopping in Union Square or catching a performance in the Theater District.  There is ample parking in the nearby parking garages.  For dessert, try their Tiramisù.
author: Norris B.

description: We were hungry. They had room. It was hot and stuffy inside. My husbands dinner of salmon looked tastier than my salad. They were slammed, very busy, but still ... took too long to notice us and then to seat us. Took too waaaay long to bring me my wine. Probably would be nice and romantic if it were only half full.
author: Anita L.

description: They managed to accommodate our large group (which was good as it's a small place and a bit crowded). The food was okay, not spectacular, but tasty enough.
author: Beth T.

description:
My family and I were in the city on Christmas Eve doing different things. Half of us were watching the Forever Tango show that was in town, the other half doing some Christmas shopping. When we all got back together we were starving. We did a 360 to see what was around where we met up at, and we saw Cesario's. We decided to give it a chance. Great decision.

I believe our server's name was Katherina. She was phenomenal. I have always dreamed of the perfect server and my dreams were a reality that day. She was genuinely kind, incredibly sweet, suggesting all kinds of things for us to try (which we did by the way), and overall just knew exactly what fine dining is all about.

The restaurant was surprisingly empty and we were seated instantly by a kind gentleman. It was smooth sailing from here on out. Delicious appetizers, amazing entrees, great desserts, you name it. We had no qualms about the place whatsoever. The service was excellent, speed of the food coming out was perfect, and food quality was superb. I highly recommend coming here if you want a great dining experience because Katherina and everyone else there will give you one.
author: Jonny A.

description: The crab cakes were overcooked. The lasagna was awful, the garlic bread was cold. Only thing good was the wine but heck
author: Trey J.

description:
So many restaurants have closed in 2008, yet this place remains open. It's a mystery to me.
- The inside looks old and needs to be cleaned more often.
- A grouchy guy seems to be the owner.
- The staff looked depressed and shows little enthusiasm to provide service.
- Food portions are moderate.
- Air combat with one or two very stubborn flies is annoying.
- In my opinion, except for the carpaccio, prices are high for what u get.
- Food quality doesn't match menu prices, similar to generic hotel food.
- The only good meal I ever had here (pasta), was more than 10 years ago.
author: Luis C.

description:
My wife and I were staying at The Rex Hotel and just across the street was this Italian restaurant. We could not have been happier with the food, the service, or even the location at which they seated us. We were given a window view, candlelit table for two, while the rain fell down outside. It was perfectly romantic. 

Our server was Gwyneth and she was utterly adorable with just the right amount of attentiveness. And do you know how some servers come across as fake or insincere? Gwyneth was genuine and funny and just real with us and we loved her.

As amazing as Gwyneth is, what equally made me want to write this review was the Chicken Parmigiana. Holy Moses! This was the best Chicken Parm my wife and I ever tasted! No lie! It was delicious and so light it felt like you were eating something healthy. Haha. We even had Gwyneth tell the cook that this was the best Chicken Parm evah!! 

If you're looking for a full-bar they don't have it, just beer and wine. That's the only downside I can think to say about this restaurant. Otherwise, you will be treated professionally and kindly, and you will taste some pretty amazing food. Well, if you have the Chicken Parm that is. I can't attest to their other dishes. 

But when we go back to The City we will definitely go back to Cesario's and we hope to see Gwyneth there when we do :)
author: Steven E.

description: Service was ehhh but food was good. We had a great bottle of Mondavi and had the chicken fettuccinei and the eggplant parm. If you like old country classic Italian food, this is the place for you!
author: Kimberly B.

description: Stopped by for lunch as we were craving Italian food.  Wow!  Home made bread with pesto was immediately put on the table upon arrival.  We ordered an Anchor Steam (ice cold) beer & a San Pellegrino.  The waitress was very sweet and professional.  We decided on the Bruschetta for starters.  Fresh sweet tomatoes with the perfect balsamic vinaigrette and olive oil.  Sheer perfection!  I have never tasted anything so delicious.  I ordered the prawns with spaghetti and veggies.  Little did I know, this dish is large enough for 2 people to star.  Delicious!!!  My friend ordered the Lobster Ravioli and let me taste a small bite.  Unbelievable! We had an engagement that evening, so we ordered a Cannoli to go.  The best!  Better than the one I had in New York City!   The service was sheer perfection and we regret that we did not have enough time to return.  If we stay in San Francisco, we will return!  Mahalo for the fresh ingredients and lovely lunch.  Your restaurant restored our faith in Italian food.
author: Kehau S.

description:
Ate here because we had a seminar next door at Marine's Memorial theater.
The restaurant was 3/4 full. The man with the tie gave us a dinner  menu and after asking several times he gave us the lunch menus.
It then proceeded to get worse.
Two of our group ordered pasta and two of ordered panininis.
It took 30 mins for the pasta to be served and 10 more mins for our sandwiches.
The server did not bring bread for the pasta dishes.
My club sandwich was supposed to have  turkey , cold cuts and cheese.
When I finally got it it had razor thin cut of ham and a slice of bacon- no cheese.

Service was with a grimace and very slow.

Eat elsewhere if if have a chance.
author: George F.

description: Good service. Food good. Window seat people watching is excellent!
author: Joe G.

description:
GREAT LOCATION, GREAT FOOD.  

I hadn't been here in 5 or 6 years and didn't know what to expect after reading some of the negative reviews. Fortunately, I was not disappointed.  The food was great and our server recommended an excellent wine - that was below my price point!  The appetizers (Bufo Mozzerella and Bruchetta) were particularly good with super fresh veggies and flavors that popped!  The bread was light, sweet and tasty. We tried cups of both the clam chowder and minestrone soup and could not decide which was our favorite.  

A very cool restaurant on the corner of Bush and Mason that is great for people watching and a short walk from Union Square.  Definitely not a "tourist / gimmick" restaurant, but if you are looking for a nice restaurant with great food that is not outrageously priced (I think most pastas and entrees were in the $15-25 range), you will like this place.
author: Chris A.

description: Service was decent - but we were the first customers for lunch so it was expected.  Ordered a Calamari Appetizer and garlic bread - the Calamari was the typical ring type and pretty rubbery.  The ravioli could have been from a can and the overpriced pesto I had could have been from the Olive Garden - and probably would have been better.  To pricey for sub standard food - not a good representation of what San Francisco has to offer.
author: David S. Y.

description: We're staying in San Francisco for a few days @ the Marriott on Union square  & wanted Italian for dinner. My hubby found this place on Open Table & made reservations because it had a good rating & was a very short walk from the hotel- and what a lovely little place it was! We walked in & were seated immediately because reservations are a MUST in this place due to the very small & very packed dining room. People were waiting to get in & had long wait times. We ordered calamari for the starter which was fresh, hot & delicious! For dinner we all ordered from the specials menu. My husband had the lobster ravioli, which he devoured because he said it was amazing ! My son & I had the seafood parpadelle in light red sauce & that was absolutely yummy- it was heaping with shrimp , clams mussels etc. The service was excellent & it was reasonably priced. This place comes highly recommended if your looking for tasty Italian!! Two thumbs up!!
author: Cc M.

description: Great food but service not so good.  We did arrive late for our reservation but they forgot one of the entrees but the food is very good.  Parking can be hard.  They remove the forgotten item and we had to leave to get to a 8pm show start.  We will eat here again.
author: David B.

description: My friends were in town and staying at the Marine's Memorial Club & Hotel so we went here before our show started because it was next door. I had the Penne Al Melanzane-eggplant, kalamata olives, tomatoes, roasted garlic, fresh spinach. It was pretty good. This is a small place in the shopping center district  of SF, so its pretty touristy.  The food was good it really reminded me of a place like pasta pomodoro, very basic italian food. The service was good and attentive. Prices were pretty good. If I was staying in the area again I would come back, but it was nothing to special to go out of my way to come back.
author: X X.

description: I've never had a bad meal here. Their potato/mushroom gnocchi are amazing.
author: Madalyn W.

description:
3 stars for the food. 5+ stars for the service.  

The food is pretty good. We were greeted with an abundance of fresh and tasty bread.  The calamari appetizer was tender and tasty and my simple pasta dish was also satisfying.  The price point is reasonable and I could see coming here on a semi-regular basis if I lived in the neighborhood.

Our server, Katherina, was phenomenal.  She is one of the most genuinely attentive and nice servers I have ever had the pleasure of meeting.  On the spectrum of service, from downright rude, to disinterested, to courteous, to excellent, to cloying, Katherina hits the sweet spot in a way that few others have done in my experience of SF dining.  I think perhaps she genuinely enjoys what she does.  Wow!

The personalized touch made all the difference.  Thank you!
author: Jane F.

description:
We came in on a Saturday night and were seated pretty quickly. Service was attentive and friendly. The bread was served right away and super fresh. Thank goodness...we were starved! 

Now for the food...absolutely divine. I had the polenta lasagna and it was the best I've ever had. It was served piping hot and a huge portion. I can't wait to try another dish the next time I drop by when I'm around Union Square.
author: Tiffany P.

description: My favorite casual Italian on Sutter. First SanFran restauraunt I ever ate at, been back at least once every couple years. The food is tasty and consistent--butternut squash, linguini dishes, etc., are sublime.
author: Raster M.

description: I always eat at this restaurant when I come to San Francisco.  Service is promp but not rushec.  The servers are casual and pleasant but never intrusive and always courteous and professional.  Food is lovely and portions just right.  Butternut squash ravioli is my favorite.  Wine by the glass options are plentiful.
author: Gail C.

description: I had dinner at Cesario's with three friends before going to the ACT theatre.  Super combo for a evening downtown. The ambiance of the restaurant (intimate, slightly classy but warm) is a perfect mood setting for theatre.  The food was good (main courses were too salty and pasta could have been more al dente, but it might be a question of taste).
author: Catherine C.

description: We went here for dinner one night while on our trip  to SF. The food was pretty good nothing too special we got the bruschetta, butternut squash ravioli and the chicken parm. The bruschetta was really good! The butternut squash was a fairly small portion and had pretty good flavor. The chicken parm was okay, the chicken was good but the mashed potatoes were bland. What ws strange was that if you came in with a party of two and they sat you in a booth they would sit a random party of two right next to you! This seemed odd to me and I felt like you couldn't really have a private conversation with strangers sitting next to you. The service was really fast though which was great! We were probably in and out of there in 45 minutes.
author: Livvy B.

description:
First of all, as I was sitting down, I guess I dropped several dollars on the floor but server (Gwyn?) was honest enough to let me know so I would say the service was good. 

I had Gamberettini Capell and it was good but it was too small.  When I got home I had to get more to eat.
author: M M.

description: Bolognese was out of a jar level taste.  Caprese salad was bland and the tomatoes were not ripe.  Plus the mozzarella was tasteless.  The crab soup was super fishy and the color was brown instead of a light beige.  All in all not worth the money and I would encourage someone to just get a slice of pizza around the corner.
author: Douglas D.

description: It was my first visit it San Francisco and I couldn't wait to have some great Italian food. I ordered the Buf Mozzarella salad first.  Since mozzarella was in the name you would think the main ingredient would be mozzarella.  There were 4 half tiny balls over tons of basil with less then ripe tomatoes and the balsamic vinegar was missing. My main dish was veal parm with risotto.  The risotto was bland and cold. The Veal was I believe frozen patties with provolone cheeses that I think was microwaved.  It was so bad I did not eat any of it. The sever came over and ask how everything was and I told her my food was horrible and I couldn't eat it. She asked me if I wanted a box and when I said no she brought the check. No manager, no apologize and I was expected to pay for it.  Very sad!
author: shari s.

description: We found good reliable italian food in the middle of the Holiday rush on the busiest tourist weekend of the year.  Good service and reasonably priced.  Had a delicious chicken piccata.
author: Kathy W.

description: Flew in from Seattle, checked in to the Marriott down the street and walked into Cesario's.  I got a great seat by the window.   Service was reliable and timely. Cesar salad was bland.  I ordered the Truffle Gnocchi and it was disappointing.  Edible but it was stuffed, almost like mini raviolis.  The tiramisu was drizzled with hersheys chocolate syrup.   Just ok.
author: Patrick P.

description: What a terrible place!  I arrived 5 minutes before Noon and the owner refused to let me in and stated that the restaurant did not open until Noon.  Once inside, he asked me in a very unfriendly tone if I had a reservation, which I did.  One member of my party was unable to attend the lunch, so the owner moved us away from the window and stuck us in a dark corner of the restaurant even though there were no other people there.  The service was very rude and the food came out slowly.  I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.  If I could give zero stars I would.  Absolutely hands down, one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had!
author: Cynthia O.

description:
Despite all the 1 star reviews, I actually really liked this place. Maybe I was just lucky :]

The boyfriend and I came here for our last dinner while in SF. We got there early so there were plenty of tables to choose from. Luckily we got a window seat overlooking Sutter. The menu was simple and to the point. I ordered the Ravioli Alla Fiorentino and the boyfriend ordered the Penne Alla Bolognese. Both were superb. 

Service was amazing as well. The waitresses came by several times to refill water and our bread basket. Who could complain with service like this. Overall it was a great experience.
author: Maxine H.

description:
Your food will take forever to come to your table.

Your servers will be attentive cause they have to be...Because your food wil take almost 45 minutes to come to your table!

Speaking of the food...I have had better meals at Olive Garden. It is really not great.  Red sauce has the quality and taste of Ragu and really, and the bread....just buy grocery dinner rolls...cause they are basically the same thing.

Go to North Beach and find an Italian restaurant.  Not this...
author: Katrina N.

description:
I was in SF for business and was looking for a decent place for dinner.  I love small intimate Italian restaurants and this was only a couple of blocks from the hotel.

I had the veal piccata with a spring greens salad.

I thought it was a small starter salad when I ordered it, but when it came it was served on a dinner plate.  I loved the dressing, but the waitress should have mentioned the size.

The veal was excellent, with a balanced flavor of wine and lemon.  My compliments to the chef!  It was served with a wedge of very flavorful polenta and steamed veggies.

The only drawback was the limited selection of wine by the glass.  Since I was by myself, there was no way I could drink a whole bottle for dinner then function the next day.

Price wise, it was moderate.  I got out of there for $40, which was a great value for what I had.

If you are in the neighborhood, I would highly recommend it.
author: Scot K.

description: We were looking for something to eat before a show downtown and happened on this place.  Funny, after living here for 21 years, I'd never noticed it!  We loved it...the service was excellent, and the food was so good!  The spaghetti and meatballs was just what I was craving.  The pasta was clearly homemade and fresh, and was cooked perfectly, and the meatballs were veal and pork, and delicious.  My husband's chicken picatta was outstanding as well.  Even the starter salads ruled.
author: David B.

description: The veal was very good but the sides on my wife's steak dinner were cold when they arrived.  The choices on the wine list were sparse and sub standard.  Dessert was also lack luster.  I ordered the cannoli and the shell was soggy like it was frozen then put in a microwave.  I will not eat there again.
author: Bill D.

description: Not for children or babies. Restaurant is very small even by SF standards. Food isn't amazing. If you want delicious Italian - go to North Beach...
author: Erin L.

description: I am sad to say that my father in law had a cockroach run up his leg at lunch. He is such a gentleman that he did not say anything while dining  - but that crap is totally unacceptable! I left a message for the GM to call me but no response as yet.
author: Chris M.

description: Absolutely awful!  Went in for dinner after 7 PM ordered two salads and two pasta dishes never received my pasta dishes.  The manager then told me because I ordered the salads that threw everything off.  Avoid, I paid $25 for 2 salads that were not that good.
author: Mike S.

description: We had a delightful time.  Ate lunch on a Sunday with family.  Had the Salmon Medallions.  Others had Truffle Gnocchi, Pear Salad.  Food was very good.  House wine paired well with the meal.  Alex served us.  Atmosphere was impeccable; quite and relaxing restaurant.  Already planning next time to SF will come back with family.
author: Eric D.

description:
Good food and atmosphere at a reasonable cost!   The four of us enjoyed sitting in one of booths next to window facing Mason.
A good place to watch the City coming to life with workers heading home or out on buses and Friday night diners milling all around...a good choice for us!  We ate at 6:00 ish.
The small establishment means you see the cooks applying their trade  and the food smells drift throughout.
I recommend this place for sure...
We stayed at Marines Memorial Hotel which is right next door...otherwise we might have missed this gem.
author: Niles F.

description: Great food, greater service.  I came here to have dinner for a friend's birthday and it seemed to be just the place that she had in mind.  She wanted a place that was quiet and personable, great tasting italian food, a large wine list, and tiramisu for dessert.  Cesario's delivered on all accounts and the service here was awesome.  I had the lasagna here and it was awesome, it was very authentic tasting and combined with the wine selection that we had it was even better.  If you're in the mood for Italian food and would like to avoid the large crowds that come with big name restaurants, I definitely suggest Cesario's as a viable option for dinner.
author: Derek T.

description:
Oh ridiculousness.

We were starving when we arrived in SF, and our friend had dropped us off downtown so we could find sustenance.

And that sustenance came in the form of Cesario's.  Yes yes yes, Italian goodness!
We ordered the eggplant parmesan (not the crappy fried breaded shit, but the real stuff) & the pollo alla piccatta.  My friend Wendy ordered the truffle gnocchi and HOLY SHIT - everything was so.  freaking.  good.

And then we wandered over to Cantina afterwards (see review below).
YAY!
author: Lily S.

description:
Nothing fabulous...nothing horrible...odd service.

I have worked nearby for about 3 years and avoided this place due to the constant emptiness and mediocre reviews.  But today, I was craving Italian!  So I crossed my fingers and walked in.  Completely empty & well past any possible lunch rush...eye longed for one of the big plush booths with a great window view.  No luck! I was told that those were only for parties of 2-4 people, I looked around, glanced at my watch.  No luck...she stuck to her guns and seated me at a tiny table for two.  Aside from the booth thing--her service was excellent.

I ordered the polenta fritte and linguini carbonara.  The bread was average-the same type they serve at nearby Persimmon & Piraat (sam owner/manager apparently) and the whipped "butter" was kinda nasty.  The polenta was yummy though could have been a bit more golden and crispy.  The pasta was good, full of bacon perfect for this bacon-lover.  The to-go box/bag was, well, oddly cheap and ackward for a restaurant this nice.  Lunch for under $20 with leftovers would almost make me wanna give an extra star...but then I start thinking of the booth thing!
author: Mamma B.

description:
Once upon a time I lived really close to this place and actually enjoyed a meal or two here... I always ordered the same...veal scalopine with mashed potatoes with a nice mushroom gravy.
They had a decent cook and a very nice waiter named Angel. A doll.
So good times on quiet afternoons catching up with friends back east on my cell.

However, whenever the owner was around I could feel a change in the entire waitstaff. No more personal conversation , no talk , no nothing .  I later heard that he was hated by all , paid them duggets and treated them like dogs..

This guy strikes me as one of those old Mexican wannabe patrone (master/ lord) types ! .
He hulks in with a scowll on his face and gives everyone including the customers the evil eye!

I couldn't believe how he treated his staff, always with a disdain that cuts with a knife. He would even scowl at me everytime he saw me.
Probably thought I should be out in a field, pregnant  and cutting some kind of plant all day long, And he owns 3 other restaurants in the area! 

Roxanne Cafe at 570 Powell, 
El Sotano at 550 Powell 
Piraat at 696 Sutter.

Each and everyone of these places are a joke. The reviews are horrible on Yelp for every single one of them except Cesarios !

I have personally eaten at all of them and won't waste my energy on reviewing the rest so I decided to do one review for all. 

And my opinion is... in this day and age of commercial rent being what it is off Union Square in San Francisco ( ENORMOUS)....

How can these places make the monthlys with bad food and mediocre service ? ! !
author: Katherine N.

description:
Worst experience ever!

If it was legal to light restaurants on fire this would be the one I choose to light match to wood.

It started out all fine and dandy. My friend and I got a nice little window seat. At least it was nice until the free window show came. She/he was tall and skinny and lookin` for lovein` in ALL the wrong places.

Anyway, we order our appetizer, garlic bread, it was nothing special. What we were really looking forward to was the "fresh" oysters with pasta. We waited, and waited and when it got to the table it was cold. There was no steam coming off of it at all. The only thing that was warm was the noodles. Even the dish was like ice. We had lost our appetite.

We decided we were going to return the untouched dish of cold food and pay our bill and not cause a scene and just go some where else to eat. So I casually go to the waiter/owner/boss guy and tell him our situation. He takes the dish of food away and gives us our bill.

He did not remove the item from our bill. So I tell him politely to remove it from our bill since we did not eat any of it. He then says quite loudly that I am just trying to get a free meal. So I shout out, "To get a free meal I would actually have to eat something!" He still would not take it off the bill. So I said bring the food back I will eat the uncooked fish and when I get food poisoning I will come back and sue him.

By this time two other tables had gotten up and left. My friend tossed $40 (for two glasses or wine and garlic bread) in his face and we left.

So please don't go here. Thanks.
author: Cat R.

description: Very surprised at how good this was.  We expected "Olive Garden" type food but this was much better.  The Pancetta Spinach salad was excellent as was the garlic break and Chicken Parmesan.  Very quaint setting.  We would suggest this to all our friends.
author: Jamie B.

description:
The mid westerners next to me could not stop talking about the chicken.  Maybe I take ours for granted.

The wine was okay.  Suggested by the staff.

I had a caeser and spinach salads.

Yeah two salads... what up?  That's how I roll.

They were shrug your shoulders "meh".

There are so many restaurants!  This is fine.  Go to Colonial.  On a lark.  It is a street down, and probably the same price and a little better.  Atmosphere is MUCH better.... because the cramped seating in the street corner open to smokers and cab waiting people and loitering hooligans with nothing better to do than end up bathed in the halogen glow of the streetlamp.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Rolled into Cesario's after a day of wine tasting in Sonoma.  It was in the neighborhood near our hotel.  Excellent service and the food was delicious.  Wife had the veal Marsala and I had the linguini with mussels and clams.  Great food and service at a reasonable price.  Great tiramisu .
author: Erik L.

description:
5 stars for Katherina, who was the loveliest waitress I've ever had the pleasure of being served by. I cannot stress how much of a difference it made to be waited on by such a sweet and attentive person. I would come back just for her! In fact, it was almost closing time (on a Friday evening) when we arrived, but they were very welcoming all the same and opened the kitchen up again just for us. 

The food and quality-price ratio were both decent (3 stars?)... My Cappellini Al Pomodoro was tasty, but not spectacular, for $14. The calamari and accompanying dip-sauce were, however, delicious! The location is ideal and the restaurant itself is very quaint, which makes for a delightful and intimate experience. 

I highly recommend Cesario's for a simple, romantic dinner on an otherwise "meh" weekday evening.
author: G. J.

description: Truffle Gnocchi paired with a glass of red did it for me. I was sold! We stumbled upon this place while trying to avoid the sudden rain storm that hit. Glad we ventured in. Superior wait staff. Our waitress was super friendly and knowledgeable. She recommended a great wine and was just delightful. It is a little small so don't bring anything bulky. Truly an authentic taste.
author: Trish B.

description:
So this is my first review even though I have been reading them forever.

We came here on Valentine's Day without a reservation around 9pm, but were seated within a few minutes. We were promptly greeted by this wonderful waitress, a beautiful blond who really knew how to give a fine dining experience. We ordered a half bottle of pinot grigio, I had the truffle gnocchi, and she had some kind of spinach ravioli.

We also ordered some garlic bread to start out with, and this is where Cesario's lost a star - they were out of garlic! They were out of garlic? Yes, an Italian restaurant that ran out of garlic. Even the aforementioned waitress was surprised by this fact. 

So she brings out the wine and in true fine dining fashion, pours a taste in my glass for my approval, and then pours us both glasses. I love that. The food came out in a timely manner, and my gnocchi was delicious. Given I have never had gnocchi before, but I loved it. It was even missing the garlic so I could only imagine how much better it could have been. She enjoyed her ravioli dish, I tried a bite and it was pretty good but I loved mine so much more. We finished, and she tried her best to sell us on some dessert but we had to pass, drinking had to be done.

All in all it was rather expensive but I do suppose it is a tourist attraction more than a local spot. Would have been five stars if they had garlic. I guess we just were lucky to not have any of the horror stories I have read others experienced on here.
author: Chris B.

description: Went here with our preteen kids at 6 PM. Not one smile from the waitress during the whole visit. Got the impression that we should get out of there rather fast to get the table booked again - the place is rather small. The food was ok but at the price not good enough.
author: Gert K.

description:
Walked in on a Sunday night and was seated right away with no wait.  The restaurant wasn't empty, but there were a few extra tables.

The bread was nothing special, but was okay.  We definitely appreciated that the butter was room temperature and whipped, instead of butter wrapped in tin foil and straight from a refrigerator.  

We started out by ordering the polenta fries.  They were actually very good and we both enjoyed them.  Lightly fried and nice and creamy inside.  For our entrees, we had the pesto linguini and the chicken parmesan.  Both were pretty good.  We did think that the food could have used more salt, but in general we were pretty satisfied with our meal.  We would definitely revisit this restaurant.
author: Matt V.

description: excellent italian dinner, service with a smile!
author: Gus W.

description:
Tight, tight fit for a wheelchair, but once in there, I thoroughly enjoy my Ceasar Salad with real Parmesan cheese and dressing.  My partner had Chicken Parmesan, they said it was tender and flavorful. 
The server was attentive and courteous.  We'd definitely return there again and again.
author: Corinne d.

description:
Boo.  I wanted the butternut squash ravioli, and they were out, which I suppose is not entirely their fault given that I rolled in at like, 9:53pm.  So I had the truffle gnocchi instead.  It was considerably subpar.  (Funny thing about subpar: when you think of it in a golfing context, isn't that actually a good thing?  Don't you want something to be subpar?  Odd.) 

Anyway.  I did not finish it.  Which is highly uncommon.  Then I ordered the chocolate gelato for dessert, which proved to be plain old chocolate ice cream, and it had that crystalline texture you get when you stick your ice cream in the door of the freezer and then proceed to open and close the freezer a number of times so it melts and refreezes and melts and refreezes and generally becomes gross.  I was not impressed.
author: Renee G.

description: Ate here on the first night of a 4 day stay in S.F.  Its is tiny and seating a bit uncomfortable.  You forget all about sitting in your neighbor's lap as soon as you wrap your lips around anything they serve.  The food was incredible.  The service was very good.  You do have to be a people friendly sort of person though.  If you are the type to place your bag on the seat next to you so little old ladies cant be seated then this is not the place for you.  If you are warm, friendly, like people and love to eat, then step right in.
author: Joseph L.

description: We decided to eat here since it was across the street from our hotel.  I love my Italian food...this place is good, not great.  I ordered the penne pasta with eggplant and hubby got the sea bass.  Good experience.
author: Caryn M.

description:
I stay in the city on a weekly basis for work. I am always up to try a new place. I passed by here a few times on my nightly strolls and thought I would try it. 

My coworker and I grabbed dinner here last night. The place is tiny and if you are rather round, slight uncomfortable. We tried the $30 four course meal. Comes with soup, salad, entree and dessert. 

We both ordered wine, a fair selection if you are not a big wine drinker. Better than some other Italian place that have only Chianti. Okay prices on the wine, a good deal on half bottle I thought. 

We both had the French Onion Soup. I thought the soup was good. The Caesar salads we both ordered were not that good. The lettuce was more yellow that green, the dressing nonexistent. Ick.

My friend order the Eggplant Parmesan. She really enjoyed it. She also love food at the Cheesecake Factory - so that is open to interpretation. I ordered the steak. I ordered it medium-rare. It came medium-rare, which is rare. The mashed potatoes tasted like they came from a box. The steamed vegetable were very tasty though. The steak as fine. I do not normally order steak out, my husband is an excellent grill-master. I wasn't in the mood for pasta. So, I give the steak a 3. Pretty decent for restaurant fare. No gristle and not fatty.

I have read the other reviews on the service. Our service was adorable. She was attentive, soft-spoken and cute as a button. The manager was there, looked a little anal but didn't seem grouchy to me. 

Oh - and the dessert was fantastic. 

I do prefer a more sophisticated class of food, but for good, earthy fare, the place was good and the service was great. I would eat here again.
author: Candida R.

description: The place was clean and tidy and all but service was horrendous. Waitress was pleasant but disorganized and slow. Took forever to get coffee then again forever to have order taken and forever again to get served. When food it finally arrived arrived it was edible but not great.
author: Sam B.

description: The food was very very good if not excellent.  The quarters are very tight, but they were very accomodating and give generous portions.  The wait staff was nice and the dinners very reasonable.
author: Linda D.

description: Went here with the fam on vacation. We had been here once before and weren't too impressed. However, we were pleasantly surprised tonight. It was great! I had the linguini carbonara which was so great! We also ordered a bottle of red wine. The hostess was so kind! We will definitely be back when we come through SF again!
author: Daniel P.

description:
We love stopping here after a nice exhausting workout on Sundays. The staff are very pleasant and the fact that they are actually OPEN during the 2-4 timeframe in the afternoon is worth one star (or more) to me!

The food is nothing to get too excited about - good quality but nothing that really makes it stand out from other Italian places in the city. The service and the hours are what brings it to the forefront. Prices are decent and fair for what they provide - portions are generous!
author: Sarcastic T.

description:
The food was good--I had a delicious pasta with a smoked chicken and white sauce.  My mom had rack of lamb, also delicious.  Creme brulee was just ok, and a bit cool/cold in the middle.

Wine prices and selection were decent but nothing to write home about.

With all this plus our prime window seat and relatively clean bathroom, this could have been a three-star, possibly four-star review.

But the service was just miserable.  First, we waited ten minutes for a table to be cleared.  Then we waited some more at the table for our server.  Then we waited quite a while for our food (so much so that a table of two that sat down behind--and after--us was able to order drinks, entrees, pay and leave before we even got through our main courses).  Then we waited to order coffee and dessert.  And again, we waited for the bill.

I was meeting a friend after dinner, so my mom shooed me out the door.  She waited another 15 minutes (what can I say?  we're Midwesterners, we don't try to rock the boat) before getting up to ask the waitress for the bill.  The waitress asked her where she was sitting.  In hindsight, my mom thought she could have left and no one would have noticed.

keep in mind that this is a very small restaurant--about 4 booths, and 6 tables--so at most there can only be about 25-30 people dining here at one time.

Overall, the experience was not good.
author: Sarah B.

description:
In town for the weekend, we were able to escape a lot of the noise of Union Square and were seated right in the corner window seat.  It was fun to people watch and enjoy some fine desserts.

We didn't have entrees, only wine and desserts, so I can't back up any of the other comments here.
author: Jeff W.

description: Host was on it.  Remainder of service was terrible.  The waitress only came to our table when I waved her down.  It was difficult to get her attention as she would not make any eye contact.. We only received our wine half way through our dinner.  The worst part about it was that instead of apologizing she made excuses and blamed it on her manager.  The  salmon was nice .  The sirloin strip was akin to a steak one would expect with their steak and eggs at ihop. To many good restaurants in San Fran to waste an evening on average food and bad service
author: Bev S.

description: My wife and I enjoyed dinner last eveing prior to seeing "Forever Tango" at Cesario's.  The food and serve was excellent and they were super in catering to my wife's special medical diet.  I rated it 5 stars and would go back again and again.
author: Bill M.

description:
Had lunch the other day; over-boiled pasta.  Need I say more?
Their carbonara sauce was bland, and the pancetta flavor and aroma was completely flat.  One of the worst Italian I've had recently.
author: John L.

description: Not good.  Subway would have been better.  Slow service.  Drinks were syrupy and weak and chicken rubbery.  Marsala Sauce was too sweet.  Got hungry and desperate so went in without reading reviews... Our mistake. Dropped 80$ on terrible food... Sad
author: Megan B.

description: One of the worst chicken picatta dishes we have eaten.  Cold vegetables, dry rice that they call rissoto, ceasar salad with wilted small pieces of romaine, wonder bread slices with whipped margarine?????  Nice server but incredibly bad food
author: Doug G.

description: I had just gotten over a cold and was pushing my way through an extremely rainy and cold day in the city, when I stumbled upon Cesario's.  My mother and I had been shopping (unsuccessfully for a mother of the bride dress) when we delightedly walked past.  It had such a warm and inviting vibe to it and it was practically empty; we just couldn't pass up its charming curb appeal. I ordered the truffle gnocchi, it was impeccably light and creamy and full of flavor that surprised you with each delicious bite.  My mother ordered some butternut squash raviolis that were equally satisfying.  Our waitress, whose name I can't remember was a pleasantly out going and personable.  She was never short on service and attentiveness, and spoke with a charming Russian accent that was never without a friendly welcoming smile.  This place may not be fancy, but if your looking for great homey italian food with awesome service, its definitely somewhere i would recommend to you! I will be positively be returning to Cesario's during my next visit to the bay area.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
It has been a while since I have been to Cesario's, but I recalled having a wonderful rainy day meal with wine there and so I was moved to go back yesterday. I actually called ahead and took my lunch to go. 
Well, I am so dissapointed. For starters, they have removed the prices from their online menu, which is because they have jacked their prices up on average of $3 per dish. Second, I ordered something simple, Penne de Bolognese and a Cesar Salad. Something an itailan restaurant should be able to handle.
Upon picking up my food, I paid its Ransom of $27, you've ot to be kidding me,but I was hungry and desperate.
I arrived home and tore into what i was expecting to be an amazing (and expensive) lunch. What I got was a portion of pasta the size of a can of chef boyarde, and about as tasteful. Dry, bland, and non-satisfying. Thank goodness for the salad! or not....
How can you screw up a salad? I don't really know but the salad (again, looked like a side dish to my meal, not an additional $8.50 plus tax) was small and when i went to eat it, it had a very unnatural and un-ceasar salad like oily coating all over it. It was almost as if it was a synthetic coating to keep the lettuce from wilting, then some parmasean cheese was thrown on top of it.
Unbelievable, unbearable, and such a huge dissapointment....
I'll still give them a star for the memory of the wine and the rainy day
author: Jason D.

description: I went here for dinner and ordered take-out. The food was okay. My Truffle Gnocchi was good, but not great. It didn't have an overwhelming truffle flavor and I liked that the Gnocchi was stuffed and the cream sauce it was served with wasn't too creamy. I wish there were some more greens with the dish, as Gnocchi can taste pretty rich without something to cut that flavor. The Chicken Marsala was very unimpressive. It was bland and lacking in flavor.
